Job Description:
Manager, Sales Finance

(Internal Title: Manager, Sales Finance - Food Channel)

Location: Bridgewater, NJ / Remote

Remote Work: Possible

Travel Expected: 20% - 25%

Job Type: Full time

About the Job

At Sanofi Consumer Healthcare, we have one shared mission – we work passionately, every day, to ‘serve healthier, fuller lives’ now and for the generations to come.

In order to do so, we strive to act as a force for good by integrating sustainability along our business and employees’ mission and operate responsibly from both a social and environmental point of view.

Everything we do is centered around people’s interests – our consumers, our customers, healthcare professionals, and our employees – across the world.

We are building loved brands that serve 1bn consumers worldwide, through our key platforms: Allergy, Physical & Mental Wellness, Pain, Digestive Wellness and Cough, Cold & Flu.

We aspire to become the best Fast Moving Consumer Health (FMCH) company In & For the world and we aim to build a work environment where people can thrive, grow, enjoy and be at their best.

Our Team

The Sanofi Customer Sales Finance Manager, Food Team plays a key role in providing Financial acumen for the Food Channel business.  You are the primary liaison on all financial matters (S&OP, operating budget, payment terms, deductions, ROI) to include driving the Financial Acumen knowledge for the entire team. You apply your detailed financial knowledge and expertise of Club/Value and Sanofi to drive the partnership, strategic guidance and support services that our business units need to operate efficiently and effectively while exceeding sales and volume goals. You report to the Director Sales Finance. As the Financial expert for the business, you embrace effective financial partnering and represent the centricity of all strategic and operational decisions providing insight, shaping options and driving results. You will provide strong analytical support to the sales team and have responsibility to ensure plans are sufficient to deliver both internal commitments as well as Joint Business Plan targets with our partners.

Main Responsibilities

  • Act as the primary point of contact for financial and analytical expertise at Food Channel.

  • Manage the S&OP forecast and operating budget for the Customer Teams.

  • Support regular cross-functional reviews of business plans to lead ROI across food customers.

  • Work with the Food teams to disseminate best practices, standard processes and procedures.

  • Lead the risk and opportunity process to enable a GM mindset on all food customer go-to-market decisions.

  • Lead the deployment of a consistent Customer P&L while coaching team members on the adoption of a financial mindset.

  • Manage Trade Spend reporting and forecasting, guiding the team on efficient business plans.

  • Support the team leader and internal finance management teams to influence decisions to drive business results across the portfolio of Sanofi brands.

  • Lead stakeholders and collaborate with Sales Team Leaders and key stakeholders to ensure solid business decisions that align with financial goals of Food Channel.

About You

Exper i en c e

  • 5-+ years' experience in Finance or accounting-related function.

  • 3+ years' experience in an OTC/Packaged Goods business environment.

Qualifications

  • A strong leader with demonstrated track-record for delivering results and insights with superior financial judgement.

  • Must have strong financial acumen and understanding of customer profitability concepts, trade promotions, forecasting, budgeting and related monthly financial and accrual processes.

  • Demonstrated ability to form and maintain trusted collaborative working relationships with key stakeholders internally and externally.

  • Translating strategy into action - a compelling narrative, motivating others, setting objectives and delegation.

  • Strong interpersonal, written/oral communication and presentation skills.

  • Organized, dependable and self-motivated with the ability to excel in a fast-paced environment.

  • Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Accounting or Finance.

  • MBA or CPA, or commensurate experience a plus.

Who you will work with

  • Collaborate regularly with the analytics team, which will support Finances ability to consistently capture and manage financial data across brands.
  • You will work closely with Sanofi Food Team leaders, team sales, sales strategy, RGM finance, logistics, shopper insights, IBP/demand planning, forecasting, brand/category finance roles.

The salary range for this position is $125,000 - $155,000. In addition to sales incentive (role may my eligible for long term incentive depending on level and performance); all compensation will be determined commensurate with demonstrated experience. Employees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs. Additional benefits information can be found through the link, www.benefits.sanofiusallwell.com

Job Description:
Senior Director, Sales Strategy

  • Location: Bridgewater, NJ
  • Hybrid schedule & 15% - 30% travel
  • Job type: Full-Time

About the Job

At Sanofi Consumer Healthcare , we have one overarching mission - to work passionately, challenging ourselves and our industry every day, to build a healthier future by helping people, help themselves, bringing “Health in Your Hands”.

Our teams are building trusted & loved brands that connect with hundreds of millions of consumers worldwide, enabling better self-care for individuals and communities, while also contributing to a healthier planet. To fulfill this mission, we are embarking our consumers, our customers, healthcare professionals, and our employees in this journey because this is what will make us become the “Best Fast-Moving Consumer Healthcare (FMCH) Company In & For the World”.

We strive to act as a force for good by integrating sustainability along our business and employees’ mission and operate responsibly from both a social and environmental point of view.

To achieve this, we need strong talent who will help us shape the future of our Consumer Healthcare business and challenge our industry. At Sanofi Consumer Healthcare, we aspire to create a work environment where people can thrive, grow, and be at their best every day. Our priority is working with integrity to improve the health and well-being of people and communities where we operate, working towards making a positive impact in the world.

Main Responsibilities

  • Responsible for leading business strategy development, deployment, and execution to achieve Net Sales, Profit and market share objectives.
  • Communicates key strategies, insights, and initiatives between field and internal teams. Initiates and coordinates across a matrix environment to support goal achievement and gain cross-functional alignments.
  • Act as a liaison between Sales, Brand Marketing and other staff functions to optimize customer execution in line with strategic brand and category objectives.
  • Responsible for leading business strategy development, deployment, and execution to achieve Net Sales, Profit and market share objectives.
  • Leads the collaboration that partners with Sales and Marketing in launch/product strategies, development, selling materials, execution, and monitoring to achieve financial and brand objectives.
  • Actively leads the participation in the development of materials in support of strategic retailer line reviews.
  • Understands competitive promotion and pricing in the marketplace and works with Marketing, and Sales Leadership to recommend appropriate action on national, channel, and account-specific strategies.
  • Translate BU objectives and strategies into sales and channel-specific strategies and objectives
  • Represent customer and field voice in internal, cross-functional meetings.
  • Leads the development, implementation, and measurement of strategy on : Assortment, Merchandising, and Pricing.
  • Partners with category on the development of Shelving recommendations and category assortment strategies.
  • Supports innovation development process by gathering customer feedback, establishing selling stories and customer targets.
  • Ensure that channel-specific strategies and innovations are being developed by the BUs (e.g., club-specific SKUs, etc.) - work with the BUs and marketing to enhance this process.
  • Provide sales input into the marketing/innovation team regarding product development (e.g., pricing, pack size, etc.) - maintain the cross-channel view for new product and brand launches.
  • Build a new product launch plan (i.e., sell deck) - to articulate where we are going first with new products, right pricing, ship dates, etc.
  • Help shape the innovation pipeline by providing relevant insights into the R&D process (e.g., shopper insights, shelving, etc.) - especially for product design and packaging design
  • Own the customer planning process and oversee the development of plan creation (e.g., guidance provided by finance, input from the BU based on priorities, sales creating customer-specific plans, etc.).
  • Active participant in monthly S&OP meetings and provides high-level commentary into monthly forecast process based on monthly account demand calls.

About You

  • B.A. / B.S. degree required.
  • 8 + years of proven delivery in CPG, preferably within OTC/Healthcare and Personal Care, both top and bottom-line results required. Excellent business acumen; proficient category & segment knowledge.
  • 3+ years Sales Strategy experience preferred. Extensive macro U.S. trade channel experience to include shopper journeys, eComm, syndicated and shopper data. Proficient in all functional areas to include demand planning, business analysis, finance, shopper insights, etc.
  • A strong leader with demonstrated Sales and Sales Strategy experience with a general management mindset and capabilities.
  • Experience in working on multi-disciplinary teams and managing significant volume of projects.

Job Title: Area Business Manager - Hematology/Oncology - W. Los Angeles, CA
Job Description:
Job title : Area Business Manager, Hematology-Oncology- W. Los Angeles, CA

  • Location: Los Angeles, CA

​

About the job ​

Are you ready to share the future of medicine? The race is on to speed up drug discovery and development to find answers for patients and their families. Your skills could be critical in helping our teams accelerate progress. Join our Oncology Team as an Area Business Manager and you’ll help patients and families affected by rare and debilitating diseases .

We are an innovate global healthcare company, committed to transforming the lives of people with immune challenges, rare disease and blood disorders, cancers, and neurological disorders. From R&D, to sales, our talented teams work together, revolutionizing treatment, continually improving products, understanding unmet needs, and progress to make a real impact on the millions of patients around the world.

​

Main responsibilities: ​ ​

  • Achieve annual sales objectives through the development, maintenance, and enhancement of key customer relationships.
  • Implement business plans through leveraging all appropriate resources with Hematologists and Oncologists and other appropriate key customers.
  • Develop as product, disease state and marketplace expert to communicate product information to customers.
  • Work closely with all field partners, including, but not limited to Oncology Transplant Network Manager (ONM) as necessary to ensure strategy pull through from Key IDNs/System, Reimbursement, Account, other Area Business Managers and Medical (as appropriate).
  • Complete call reporting, business plan updates and expense reports, and operate within all Pharma compliance guidelines

​

About you ​

  • Experience : 2+ years of Oncology/Hematology sales experience OR one-year previous Sanofi Oncology/Transplant sales experience
  • Ability to think, plan, and act strategically.
  • Soft and technical skills : ​Ability to collaborate with field partners and internal colleagues to reach common goals
  • Effective oral and written communication skills
  • Education : Bac helor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university ​

​

Why choose us? ​

Job Description:
Key Account Manager – Boise (ID, MT)

  • Location: Montana, Idaho, Washington (up to 50% travel)

About the Job

Are you looking to change the landscape of a major disease area? Join Sanofi as a Key Account Manager and you can play a pivotal role in bringing a paradigm shifting Type-1 Diabetes product to market. You’ll build out a client base in within the territory with your in-depth clinical knowledge, disease education and market analytics. Working with a recently launched product you’ll have broad scope to develop sales strategies and acquire new customers.

You will be joining the National TZIELD Sales Team within the Diabetes Commercial organization and will work closely with an internal matrix team. The National Sales Team for TZIELD is an elite sales team that is launching an innovative first in class treatment for the delay of the onset of clinical Type 1 Diabetes. The focus is to clinically educate, facilitate the identification of at-risk patients through screening, and work closely with key accounts and other relevant customers to treat patients in a timely and efficient manner.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Expertise in clinical data, disease education, diagnostics, product information, selling skills, business analytics and market trends
  • Develop in-depth knowledge and understanding of each identified key account including strategic goals, value drivers, key access stakeholders, relevant business metrics, and unique challenges/emerging needs
  • Develop account plans including prioritization, integration of vertical pathways and identification of spheres of influence
  • Develop deep understanding of contracting/ product access processes at key accounts, internal and external workflows, key stakeholders, business segment and clinical evaluation/screening models
  • Develop and deepen strategic partnerships. Account interactions to include but are not limited to endocrinology / immunology ‘C-suite’ executives and key population health decision makers at the account
  • Perform targeted educational engagements with top community & health system/IDN accounts
  • Support clinical advocacy (e.g., gaining KOL endorsement) & ensure coverage on provider pathways, EMRs and/or formularies. Understand pull-through hurdles, org structures & customer ways of working to ensure cross-functional/ departmental coordination
  • Collaborating closely with cross functional team members to identify and resolve customer needs appropriately and with a high sense of urgency

About you

  • You have a hunter mentality and are a quick learner - always seeking to be impactful with your actions, continuously improving yourself, your team, and the world around you
  • You thrive on direct, honest, and supportive feedback and communication
  • You are an excellent business planner and problem solver, happy to work in ambiguity to achieve your goals
  • You have a demonstrated history of high achievement in sales for complex selling environments and disease states
  • You are a great matrix leader and partner - extremely organized, dependable, nimble, and self-motivated with the ability to excel in a fast-paced environment
  • You are very patient, and customer focused with passion to make a difference
  • B.A./B.S degree required
  • Valid driver’s license

Why choose us?

  • Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team.
  • Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally.
  • Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact.
  • Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks’ gender-neutral parental leave.
  • Join a highly motivated and passionate team where you will be working with some of the best talent in the pharmaceutical industry.

Candidates must complete all fleet safety training and must maintain an acceptable driving record regarding accidents and incidents.

The salary range for this position is $116,156.25 to 193,593.75 . In addition to sales incentive (role may my eligible for long term incentive depending on level and performance); all compensation will be determined commensurate with demonstrated experience. Employees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs. Additional benefits information can be found through the link, www.benefits.sanofiusallwell.com

Job Description:
National Account Manager, Walmart

  • Location: Bentonville, AR
  • Travel Expected:  Minimal (domestic)
  • Job Type: Full Tim e

About the Job

At Sanofi Consumer Healthcare , we have one overarching mission - to work passionately, challenging ourselves and our industry every day, to build a healthier future by helping people, help themselves, bringing “Health in Your Hands”.

Our teams are building trusted & loved brands that connect with hundreds of millions of consumers worldwide, enabling better self-care for individuals and communities, while also contributing to a healthier planet. To fulfill this mission, we are embarking our consumers, our customers, healthcare professionals, and our employees in this journey because this is what will make us become the “Best Fast-Moving Consumer Healthcare (FMCH) Company In & For the World”.

We strive to act as a force for good by integrating sustainability along our business and employees’ mission and operate responsibly from both a social and environmental point of view.

To achieve this, we need strong talent who will help us shape the future of our Consumer Healthcare business and challenge our industry. At Sanofi Consumer Healthcare, we aspire to create a work environment where people can thrive, grow, and be at their best every day. Our priority is working with integrity to improve the health and well-being of people and communities where we operate, working towards making a positive impact in the world.

Our Team:

The National Account Manager, Walmart Stores will work closely with the entire Sanofi Walmart Team to contribute to Sanofi CHC Values and Vision by maximizing long-term and short-term goals with our largest retailer partner. This position is based in Northwest, AR (Bentonville). This person must thrive in a team environment and maintain high-level customer contacts and relationships. This unique position will have responsibilities for carrying an omni sales desk as well as responsibilities to lead Sanofi’s Walmart Team Ecommerce Sales efforts. This role will have high visibility within the organization partnering with Sanofi’s Ecommerce Center of Excellence and leading the Sales Activation efforts for our largest customer.

From a digital perspective, this role will have both strategic responsibilities (generating transformative ideas for growth) and at the tactical level (partnering with the Ecommerce Center of Excellence to optimize the front end and back end organic key word strategies based on trends and insights). From a Brick & Mortar perspective, the National Account Manager will have high interactions with Walmart Buyers involving strategic decisions on new items, Trade Management, Promotional Planning, and Modular positioning. Understanding the role of the competitive environment, maintaining awareness of competitive conditions, and reporting them promptly to management are also required.

This desk is responsible for managing the Selson, ACT, Trial & Travel, and new business development opportunities (Front of Store, Clip Strips, etc). The desk also has responsibility to lead the E-Commerce Sales efforts through identifying areas of opportunity for the entire Sanofi portfolio working closely/driving alignment with the other NAM’s across the businesses.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Leverage brand strategy to develop Sanofi’s business with Walmart, to include delivering budgeted sales revenue, innovation sales, category share, profitability, and supply chain goals.
  • Partner with Sanofi Ecommerce Center of Excellence to identify optimized front end and back end organic key word search strategies based on trend leveraging PIM (Salsify)
  • Ensure all items both in-store and online are meeting the Walmart prescribed content standards & work with internal teams to execute onsite
  • Mine Profitero to identify digital shelf insights to drive Ecommerce growth
  • Deliver and own the assortment and eCommerce portfolio across the differing platforms and execute 1P 3P Strategies
  • Combine POS data with marketing and insight data to create compelling and comprehensive selling stories.
  • Develop accurate SKU-level forecasts each month based on expected demand, seasons, promotions.
  • Proactively identify business risks and opportunities/gap closing solutions.
  • Manages commercial discounts to meet or exceed sales forecast achievement, while staying within budget and policy guidelines
  • Forecasts sales volume and manages expenses within company policy guidelines.
  • Develops long term relationships both internally & externally with Walmart Merchants and cross-function  teams
  • Define customer joint business plans that consider long-term goals, strategies, and results
  • Customer Centricity: Negotiates joint business plans at customer business planning sessions that achieves customer and Sanofi CHC business unit’s short and long-term volume and profit goals while conforming to Sanofi CHC policies. These plans should ensure customer performance at or above standards in all key merchandising areas: Distribution, Pricing, Shelf and Promotion.
  • Communicates information and customer needs across the organization. Leads, organizes, and facilitates both internal and external teams to meet customer’s needs & develops conceptual presentations drawing from all internal and external resources needed.
  • Customer Promise: Integrates Sanofi CHC customer promise in its day-to-day interactions i.e. Sustainable and profitable growth, Pragmatic, actionable and shopper centric proposals, driving the category growth.
  • Performs other duties as assigned

About You:

  • B.A./B.S. required
  • Minimum of 5-10 years of proven delivery in CPG, preferably within OTC/Healthcare/Personal Care, both top and bottom-line results required.
  • Excellent business acumen; proficient category and Health Care segment knowledge.
  • A strong leader with demonstrated track-record for exhibiting an entrepreneurial spirit coupled with a general management mindset and capabilities.
  • Strong knowledge of Retail Link/Luminate, Item360, and Seller Center platforms
  • Proficient in PIM (Salsify) & Digital Shelf Software (Profitero)
  • 3-5 years' experience utilizing Nielsen or Circana IRI syndicated data with the ability to analyze and evaluate several sources of data to develop actionable insights.
  • Walmart experience preferred
  • Ability to bring outstanding interpersonal skills (including excellent oral and written communication), strong intellect and problem-solving skills to any discussion with colleagues and/or customers.
  • You are a learner - always seeking to improve yourself, your team, and the world around you.
  • You thrive on direct, honest, and supportive communication.
  • You are always thinking about how to help the teammates around you excel.
  • Extremely organized, dependable, and self-motivated with the ability to excel in a fast paced.
  • Based in Bentonville, AR

Job Title: Area Business Manager - Hematology - New Haven, CT
Job Description:
Job title : Area Business Manager-Hematology – New Haven, CT

​

Location: New Haven, CT

Additional Locations: Providence, RI

​

About the job ​

Are you ready to share the future of medicine? The race is on to speed up drug discovery and development to find answers for patients and their families. Your skills could be critical in helping our teams accelerate progress. Join our Rare Blood Disorders Team as an Area Business Manager and you’ll help patients and families affected by rare and debilitating diseases .

We are an innovate global healthcare company, committed to transforming the lives of people with immune challenges, rare disease and blood disorders, cancers, and neurological disorders. From R&D, to sales, our talented teams work together, revolutionizing treatment, continually improving products, understanding unmet needs, and progress to make a real impact on the millions of patients around the world.

​

Main responsibilities: ​ ​

  • Achieve annual sales objectives through the development, maintenance, and enhancement of key customer relationships.
  • Implement business plans through leveraging all appropriate resources with Hematologists and Oncologists and other appropriate key customers.
  • Develop as product, disease state and marketplace expert to communicate product information to customers.
  • Work closely with all field partners as necessary to ensure strategy pull through from Key IDNs/System, Reimbursement, Account, other Area Business Managers and Medical (as appropriate).
  • Complete call reporting, business plan updates and expense reports, and operate within all Pharma compliance guidelines

​

About you ​

  • Experience : 2+ years of Oncology/Hematology sales experience OR one-year previous Sanofi Oncology/Transplant sales experience
  • Ability to think, plan, and act strategically.
  • Soft and technical skills : ​Ability to collaborate with field partners and internal colleagues to reach common goals
  • Effective oral and written communication skills
  • Education : Bac helor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university .  Focus in business or life science preferred.

Why Choose Us

  • Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally. ​​

  • Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact. ​​

  • Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks’ gender-neutral parental leave. ​

Job Description:
Role Overview

As the Head of B2B e-Commerce , you’ll play a pivotal leadership role in shaping our ambitious roadmap and strategic direction for Sanofi’s B2B e-commerce platform. Your expertise will span sales, marketing, technology, and management, allowing you to create a superior brand and shopping experience for our valued customers.

Key Responsibilities

B2B e-Commerce Strategy

  • Develop and execute a comprehensive strategy that positions Sanofi’s Cross-Business Units B2B e-commerce as the best-in-class platform in the North American space.
  • Drive innovation, customer-centricity, and revenue growth through strategic initiatives.

e -Commerce Sales and Utilization

  • Lead efforts to boost sales, conversion rates, and platform utilization by customers.
  • Optimize user experience functionality to enhance customer satisfaction and drive revenue.

e -Commerce Operations

  • Oversee the management and continuous enhancement of our e-commerce platform.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver short and long-term tactics that elevate the end-to-end customer experience.
  • Propose, review, and maintain key performance metrics to measure success.
  • Champion consistent site testing plans in partnership with our Digital and internal stakeholders.
  • Ensure the security and compliance of our e-commerce platform, safeguarding company and customer data.

Qualifications

  • Master’s Degree or MBA Preferred : Your advanced education equips you with strategic thinking and business acumen.
  • Big 5 Tech Firm Leadership Experience : You’ve thrived in a significant leadership role within one of the Big 5 US tech giants.
  • 10+ Years in E-Commerce Leadership and/or Digital Strategy : Your track record demonstrates your ability to drive growth and profitability.
  • Operational Excellence : You’ve executed successful UX/UI improvements, driven digital sales, and harnessed customer insights.
  • Leadership and Team Management Skills : You inspire and mentor your team to achieve greatness.
  • Analytical and Data-Driven : You make decisions based on insights and data.
  • Effective Communication and Interpersonal Skills : You engage with leadership and stakeholders at all levels.
  • E-Commerce Trends and Technologies : You stay ahead of the curve, keeping us at the forefront of industry advancements.

Your Impact

  • Strategic e-Commerce Processes : You’ll create and refine strategic e-commerce processes for our Commercial Business, owning the digital product landscape.
  • Change Management Roadmap : You’ll define and lead the execution of change management initiatives related to e-commerce processes and tools.

Join us on this exciting journey to redefine B2B e-commerce. Apply now and be part of a team that’s shaping the future of digital commerce!

Job Title: Area Business Manager - Pulmonology - Louisville, KY
Job Description:
Position Title: Area Business Manager – Pulmonary Louisville, KY

Location : Remote, Louisville, KY

About the Job

Are you ready to share the future of medicine? The race is on to speed up drug discovery and development to find answers for patients and their families. Your skills could be critical in helping our teams accelerate progress. Join our Pulmonary Team as an Area Business Manager and you’ll help patients and families affected by rare and debilitating diseases

We are an innovative global healthcare company, committed to transforming the lives of people with immune challenges, rare diseases and blood disorders, cancers, and neurological disorders. From R&D to sales, our talented teams work together, revolutionizing treatment, continually improving products, understanding unmet needs, and connecting communities. We chase the miracles of science every single day, pursuing progress to make a real impact on millions of patients around the world. ​

Main Responsibilities

  • Engage Pulmonary customers within assigned geographical territory and deliver clinically focused messages to introduce, launch, grow brand-share and revenue and to consistently deliver on product goals for the asthma indication
  • Collaborate and coordinate with other key field-based stakeholders to proactively address customer needs, identify market dynamics and trends, develop strategies which support brand and corporate objectives, and ensure optimal account success within their assigned geography
  • Develop strong working relationships with pulmonary experts in assigned geography as well as biologic coordinators, office staff, and other important health care personnel and key patient advocacy support groups as directed

  • Drive results by identifying key opportunities and developing strategic business plans to generate product utilization and grow territory business

  • Plan, organize, and execute local promotional speaker programs and activities

  • Participate and help lead initiatives to support sales success

  • Own business opportunities within the respective geographic area

  • Establish relationships with thought leaders in assigned territory

  • Primary objective is to drive industry-leading customer value

About You

  • Bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university

  • 3+ years of pharmaceutical, biotech, or medical device sales experience

  • Demonstrated ability to learn and apply technical and scientific product-related information

  • Proven success and positive track record of consistent sales performance in complex markets

  • Ability to operate as a “team player” in cooperation with collaboration partners and internal colleagues to reach common goal

  • 2 years selling sub-cutaneous self-injectable (or office-administered IV) biologics preferred.

  • 2 years of selling experience in pulmonary disease or other immunology disorders preferred

Why Choose Us

Job Description:
R2739894 Director, Club Channel

  • Location: Remote
  • Travel: 25-40% of the time
  • Job type: Full time

About the job

At Sanofi Consumer Healthcare , we have one overarching mission - to work passionately, challenging ourselves and our industry every day, to build a healthier future by helping people, help themselves, bringing “Health in Your Hands”.

Our teams are building trusted & loved brands that connect with hundreds of millions of consumers worldwide, enabling better self-care for individuals and communities, while also contributing to a healthier planet. To fulfill this mission, we are embarking our consumers, our customers, healthcare professionals, and our employees in this journey because this is what will make us become the “Best Fast-Moving Consumer Healthcare (FMCH) Company In & For the World”.

We strive to act as a force for good by integrating sustainability along our business and employees’ mission and operate responsibly from both a social and environmental point of view.

To achieve this, we need strong talent who will help us shape the future of our Consumer Healthcare business and challenge our industry. At Sanofi Consumer Healthcare, we aspire to create a work environment where people can thrive, grow, and be at their best every day. Our priority is working with integrity to improve the health and well-being of people and communities where we operate, working towards making a positive impact in the world.

Our Team:

The Director of Club Channel is the primary strategic leader for the Club Channel. You'll lead our comprehensive business plan and inspire a dedicated team, along with agency support, representing the entire Sanofi portfolio. Also, play a direct and vital impact on the company’s future growth and success, as we continue to build innovation and scale for our portfolio while significantly broadening the awareness, trial potential, and efficiency for the overall business.

Our sales team should deeply understand our brands and the consumers who use our brands. We refer to retailers as “partners” – they are our partners in service of our consumers.

  • Self-motivated and capable of inspiring others in highly ambiguous, complex situations.
  • Possesses curiosity and a passion for creating breakthrough moments in store merchandising and store operation execution.
  • Demonstrates collaborative behavior and execution in delivering excellent programming for Sanofi’s brands at retail.
  • Demonstrates strong interpersonal, written/oral communication, and presentation skills.
  • Shows eagerness to learn, striving for personal improvement, as well as that of the immediate team and the broader community.
  • Promotes and leads with direct, honest, and supportive communication.
  • Exhibits extreme organization, dependability, and self-motivation, thriving in fast-paced environments.
  • Utilizes effective, professional communication to foster strong working relationships with internal and external colleagues, remaining flexible in approach to people and situations.

Main responsibilities:

The Director for the Club Channel is a customer-facing role with the following main objectives:

  • Lead the Sanofi North America CHC strategy to develop Sanofi’s business portfolio with the Club Channel, including achieving budgeted sales revenue, innovation sales, category share, profitability, and supply chain goals. This involves leading a cross-functional team to provide total solutions capability for in-store and online success.
  • Own the establishment and execution of the overall vision and strategy to succeed with the Club Channel, collaborating to secure input, investment, and support from internal cross-functional partners.
  • Build and foster relationships with senior-level leadership at Costco, Sam’s, & BJ’s, spanning merchandising, marketing, supply chain, and store operations. This includes creating and owning a Joint Value Creation plan and scorecard, encompassing mutual growth targets and strategic investment areas for Sanofi over a 3-year period.
  • Manage and oversee the Club Channel P&L, including trade investment and overall operational execution considerations.
  • Lead and represent the singular voice of the Club Channel, advocating for Club customer expectations within internal functions and operations.
  • Develop robust category-level Joint Business Plans with corresponding scorecards that reflect mutually defined annual goals and achieve sales fundamental objectives such as distribution, shelf placement, pricing, and merchandising.
  • Lead the hiring, training, and development of top talent for Sanofi, fostering a highly collaborative and effective culture aligned with the company's Vision, Mission, and Values.
  • Manage a high-functioning team to meet the needs of Costco, Sam’s, and BJ’s and Sanofi with an optimal and mutually agreed-upon ROI.
  • Define and address necessary business questions with support from data analytics and shopper/consumer insights, positioning Sanofi as a thought leader in the Health Care and Personal Care categories.
  • Partner closely with key leadership and contacts from Costco, Sam’s & BJ’s, Sales Strategy for go-to-market planning, Distribution and Supply Chain for operational and fulfillment needs, R&D for product and display design needs, and Marketing for brand strategy and innovation.
  • Lead agency partners and ensure their strengths are leveraged to achieve mutual KPIs.

About you

  • B.A. / B.S. degree required.

  • A strong leader with demonstrated track-record for exhibiting an entrepreneurial spirit coupled with a general management mindset and capabilities.

  • 8 + years of proven delivery in CPG, preferably within OTC/Healthcare and Personal Care, both top and bottom-line results required. Excellent business acumen; proficient category & segment knowledge.

  • 3+ years Club experience preferred. Extensive macro U.S. trade channel experience to include shopper journeys, eComm, syndicated and shopper data. Proficient in all functional areas to include demand planning, business analysis, finance, shopper insights, etc.

  • Experience in working on multi-disciplinary teams and managing significant volume of projects.

  • Ability to travel 25-40% of the time

Job Title: Area Business Manager, Grand Rapids, MI
Job Description:
Job title: Area Business Manager
•Location: Remote / Field
•Travel: Ability to travel up to 75% of the time to customers, conventions, training, and other internal meetings.
•Job Type: Full time

Our Team:

Are you ready to help further shape the US Sanofi Vaccines to become a more agile, digital, and business to business-driven organization?

Do you thrive in an agile, collaborative, business acumen driven organization where positive outcomes are rewarded? Have you ever wanted to own your own franchise and be accountable to drive business outcomes across a full portfolio of vaccines, and strengthen customer relationships? We are responsible for the implementation of a new go-to market strategy within the US Sanofi Vaccines business unit and searching for several area business managers to pave the pathway forward with us.

The Sanofi Vaccines team aim is to remain an industry leader through evolving the way we operate and build our new business model. This model will be that can be responsive to fast changing customer needs and environment, engage in a Business to Business activities model that supports the growth of HCPs vaccine programs, with the right support to engage customers in the moments that matter in vaccines, while rewarding high performers and growth of our vaccines business.

Job Description:

The ABM will be responsible for engaging in account-based business to business interactions within customer segments (Pediatrics, Family/General Practice, IDN/IHNs, Health Systems, and Federally Qualified Health Centers), while presenting clinically focused selling messages to create and grow revenue and to consistently deliver the Sanofi Vaccines portfolio goals.

The ABM will act as an “account orchestrator” to provide a more cohesive customer experience and ultimately improve customer and patient outcomes by leveraging cross-functional support from internal teams across US vaccines. The ABM will demonstrate initiative, drive, and independence, and take ownership for meeting and exceeding individual business goals – simply put the ABM plays the role of business owner for their book of business. This will be accomplished by driving performance and delivering results in a compliant manner with a high degree of integrity.


The ABM will…

•Grow portfolio share and revenue and to consistently deliver on product goals.
•Be a therapeutic area expert, with the ability to position and differentiate products effectively
•Collaborate and coordinate with other key field-based stakeholders such as Medical Science Liaisons, Market Access teammates, strategic account managers, Hospital business managers, and others in their territory to proactively address customer needs
•Identify market dynamics and trends, develop strategies which support brand and corporate objectives, and ensure optimal account success within their assigned geography.
•Engage with the account and territory data, and work with internal data specialists to use insights that help HCPs operate more effectively.
•Determine optimal ABM strategy for HCPs in an agile way leveraging AI and other digital tools
•Drive results by identifying key opportunities and developing strategic business plans to generate product utilization and grow territory business.
•Understand and differentiate portfolio contracting options and compared competitive offerings through financial presentations
•Perform according to a buy/bill model, requiring a specialized skill set for operational support including but not limited to: Complex pricing analysis and price calculator usage, product shipping, monitoring contract compliance and securing contract amendments.
•Flex to changing environments and sales methodologies, including remote selling techniques
•Plan, organize, and execute local promotional speaker programs and activities
•Maximize budget allocated to the geographic territory to support execution of strategies and tactics and generate/ grow the business.
•Participate and help lead initiatives to support sales success as assigned (e.g. participate in industry related congresses, local and regional meetings and medical conferences).

Basic Qualifications

Minimum required skills & experience:
•Bachelor’s degree
•3+ years of pharmaceutical, life sciences, and/or business to business sales experience
•Broad understanding of the healthcare environment, decision making processes & market trends with a proven track record of accessing decision makers
•Possess skills and success within a business to business environment
•Strong commercial business acumen, strategic, critical thinking/problem solving and innovative thinking capabilities
•Ability to navigate a hybrid environment and determine the optimal HCP selling model
•Can dynamically adjust priorities due to changing circumstances.
•An agile learner who is comfortable operating in complex environments
•Experience with omnichannel approaches, and can execute customer engagement through appropriate channels using insights
•Demonstrated ability to use data and data analytics by unearthing valuable insights from data that can help lead to new solutions for the customer
•Demonstrate a passion and learning aptitude for science and is proactive in strengthening knowledge related to disease-state, treatment options and healthcare trends
•The ability to execute tactical initiatives, provide ongoing feedback, and prioritize multiple products.
•Broad field sales experience with demonstrated success with influencing decision makers
•Self-directed and organized with excellent execution and planning skills
•Excellent communication skills both written and oral
•Must possess valid driver’s license, be eligible for insurance coverage and must be able to safely operate a vehicle


Preferred skills & experience:
•Graduate degree
•A minimum of 5+ years of pharmaceutical, biotech or medical device sales experience with business to business experience
•Preferred 2+ years account management experience
•Enhanced digital acumen
•Strong clinical acumen
•Experience working in Market Access, Pricing, Contracting or Finance
•Proficient with MS Office and customer management databases

Our Team:

Are you ready to help further shape the US Sanofi Vaccines to become a more agile, digital, and business to business-driven organization?

Do you thrive in an agile, collaborative, business acumen driven organization where positive outcomes are rewarded? Have you ever wanted to own your own franchise and be accountable to drive business outcomes across a full portfolio of vaccines, and strengthen customer relationships? We are responsible for the implementation of a new go-to market strategy within the US Sanofi Vaccines business unit and searching for several area business managers to pave the pathway forward with us.

The Sanofi Vaccines team aim is to remain an industry leader through evolving the way we operate and build our new business model. This model will be that can be responsive to fast changing customer needs and environment, engage in a Business to Business activities model that supports the growth of HCPs vaccine programs, with the right support to engage customers in the moments that matter in vaccines, while rewarding high performers and growth of our vaccines business.

Job Description:

The ABM will be responsible for engaging in account-based business to business interactions within customer segments (Pediatrics, Family/General Practice, IDN/IHNs, Health Systems, and Federally Qualified Health Centers), while presenting clinically focused selling messages to create and grow revenue and to consistently deliver the Sanofi Vaccines portfolio goals.

The ABM will act as an “account orchestrator” to provide a more cohesive customer experience and ultimately improve customer and patient outcomes by leveraging cross-functional support from internal teams across US vaccines. The ABM will demonstrate initiative, drive, and independence, and take ownership for meeting and exceeding individual business goals – simply put the ABM plays the role of business owner for their book of business. This will be accomplished by driving performance and delivering results in a compliant manner with a high degree of integrity.


The ABM will…

•Grow portfolio share and revenue and to consistently deliver on product goals.
•Be a therapeutic area expert, with the ability to position and differentiate products effectively
•Collaborate and coordinate with other key field-based stakeholders such as Medical Science Liaisons, Market Access teammates, strategic account managers, Hospital business managers, and others in their territory to proactively address customer needs
•Identify market dynamics and trends, develop strategies which support brand and corporate objectives, and ensure optimal account success within their assigned geography.
•Engage with the account and territory data, and work with internal data specialists to use insights that help HCPs operate more effectively.
•Determine optimal ABM strategy for HCPs in an agile way leveraging AI and other digital tools
•Drive results by identifying key opportunities and developing strategic business plans to generate product utilization and grow territory business.
•Understand and differentiate portfolio contracting options and compared competitive offerings through financial presentations
•Perform according to a buy/bill model, requiring a specialized skill set for operational support including but not limited to: Complex pricing analysis and price calculator usage, product shipping, monitoring contract compliance and securing contract amendments.
•Flex to changing environments and sales methodologies, including remote selling techniques
•Plan, organize, and execute local promotional speaker programs and activities
•Maximize budget allocated to the geographic territory to support execution of strategies and tactics and generate/ grow the business.
•Participate and help lead initiatives to support sales success as assigned (e.g. participate in industry related congresses, local and regional meetings and medical conferences).

Basic Qualifications

Minimum required skills & experience:
•Bachelor’s degree
•3+ years of pharmaceutical, life sciences, and/or business to business sales experience
•Broad understanding of the healthcare environment, decision making processes & market trends with a proven track record of accessing decision makers
•Possess skills and success within a business to business environment
•Strong commercial business acumen, strategic, critical thinking/problem solving and innovative thinking capabilities
•Ability to navigate a hybrid environment and determine the optimal HCP selling model
•Can dynamically adjust priorities due to changing circumstances.
•An agile learner who is comfortable operating in complex environments
•Experience with omnichannel approaches, and can execute customer engagement through appropriate channels using insights
•Demonstrated ability to use data and data analytics by unearthing valuable insights from data that can help lead to new solutions for the customer
•Demonstrate a passion and learning aptitude for science and is proactive in strengthening knowledge related to disease-state, treatment options and healthcare trends
•The ability to execute tactical initiatives, provide ongoing feedback, and prioritize multiple products.
•Broad field sales experience with demonstrated success with influencing decision makers
•Self-directed and organized with excellent execution and planning skills
•Excellent communication skills both written and oral
•Must possess valid driver’s license, be eligible for insurance coverage and must be able to safely operate a vehicle


Preferred skills & experience:
•Graduate degree
•A minimum of 5+ years of pharmaceutical, biotech or medical device sales experience with business to business experience
•Preferred 2+ years account management experience
•Enhanced digital acumen
•Strong clinical acumen
•Experience working in Market Access, Pricing, Contracting or Finance
•Proficient with MS Office and customer management databases

Pursue progress, discover extraordinary

Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race; color; creed; religion; national origin; age; ancestry; nationality; marital, domestic partnership or civil union status; sex, gender, gender identity or expression; affectional or sexual orientation; disability; veteran or military status or liability for military status; domestic violence victim status; atypical cellular or blood trait; genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing) or any other characteristic protected by law.
The salary range for this position is $100,500 to $135,000. In addition to sales incentive (role may my eligible for long term incentive depending on level and performance); all compensation will be determined commensurate with demonstrated experience. Company Description: We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives

Job Description:
As the Account Management Partnership Solutions Leader, you are a self-starter who thrives in complexity and ambiguity. You are interested in bringing your experience in building tech-forward partnerships with customers, identifying in-market capabilities to drive population health, and developing saleable solutions in a fast-paced environment.   You are a tenured leader with experience mapping capabilities in-market, curating relationships with these partners, and triangulating this to or our largest Organized Customers across all Sanofi Vaccine Channels to enable novel Partnerships.  Partnering closely with the Head of Account Management, Health System Solutions, and Account Management Leadership, you will be responsible for delivering on key strategic projects in of executing the US Vaccines Portfolio Sales Roadmap , which is critical to driving business, cultural transformation and change management efforts. In addition, with your strong collaboration, communication, and analytical thinking skills, you will successfully and proactively diagnose risks, needs and opportunities for continuous improvement. You have a track record of being reliable, trustworthy, and have a desire to problem solve. You have a strong execution mindset and can drive impact. You will be a key partner with the US Vaccines Leadership team and instrumental stakeholder to achieving the teams' objectives / targets.

Main responsibilities:

  • Build a capability in Sanofi Account Management team to enable novel partnerships between Sanofi, our largest customers, and existing capabilities in-market to drive increased Vaccine Coverage Rates.
  • Maintain an external focus with a deep connectivity to what is possible and available in market and quickly be able to bring that knowledge to solving customer pain points in a formal partnership capability.
  • Bring a tech-forward lens to identifying key partnership targets which support execution of the Vaccine roadmap across our Portfolio of products and Strategic Account Channels.
  • Create business cases for each investment, measuring and communicating progress, while making course adjustments to drive a strong ROI.
  • Deliver operational and strategic support to ensure seamless execution of partnerships with all Strategic Accounts customers, product and portfolio strategies.
  • Support the Head of Account Management by creating a partnership strategy to enable deeper partnerships with key strategic account customers.
  • Support the decision-making process through developing informed business cases with required stakeholders for resource needs and allocation and complete trade-off analysis
  • Collaborate very closely with Marketing, Market Access, and Sales Leadership to accelerate the evolution of the sales organization through a robust Partnership Capability.

About you

Basic qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree required, Advanced Degree Preferred
  • Minimum of 15 + years Commercial experience including leading tech-forward partnerships and collaborations with large customers
  • Minimum of 3 years of sourcing solutions in-market, creating key relationships with partners, and pairing those relationships across all our large customer channels.
  • Experience leading or working on multi – level operations plans or key projects
  • Experience working with large organized customers (health systems, medical groups, IDNs, W/Ds, GPOs, etc.)
  • Exceptional business acumen, strategic agility, strong analytical and conceptual thinking combined with entrepreneurial qualities and abilities
  • Ability to execute quickly
  • Courageous leader with an inspiring change agent mindset who is willing to challenge the status quo and align others to help drive business transformation
  • Executive communication skills, ability to communicate to audiences of varied sizes and levels, both US and global
  • Detail oriented and ability to manage key projects
  • Relationship builder with strong track record of execution working with cross-functional teams comprised of: All customer facing teams, Marketing, Sales, Market Access, Trade, Medical Affairs, Legal, Business Operations, Supply Chain and Customer Support, etc.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience in both marketing, sales, and partnership functions across multiple organizations and industries
  • Related experience in commercial and marketing with previous operations experience of sizeable business preferably with Pharma / vaccines /Consumer products and external stakeholder management experience required
  • Solid financial acumen
  • Leader in an ever-evolving environment, with demonstrated use of change management strategies/tactics to influence new ways of thinking and working
  • Manages conflict with composure and demonstrates managerial courage
  • MBA or other relevant advanced degree
  • Embodies Sanofi’s Play to Win behaviors to support a cultural transformation.

Company Description: We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives

Job Title: Area Business Manager, Mission Viejo, CA
Job Description:
About the job

Job title: Area Business Manager
•Location: Remote / Field
•Travel: Ability to travel up to 75% of the time to customers, conventions, training, and other internal meetings.
•Job Type: Full time

Our Team:

Are you ready to help further shape the US Sanofi Vaccines to become a more agile, digital, and business to business-driven organization?

Do you thrive in an agile, collaborative, business acumen driven organization where positive outcomes are rewarded? Have you ever wanted to own your own franchise and be accountable to drive business outcomes across a full portfolio of vaccines, and strengthen customer relationships? We are responsible for the implementation of a new go-to market strategy within the US Sanofi Vaccines business unit and searching for several area business managers to pave the pathway forward with us.

The Sanofi Vaccines team aim is to remain an industry leader through evolving the way we operate and build our new business model. This model will be that can be responsive to fast changing customer needs and environment, engage in a Business to Business activities model that supports the growth of HCPs vaccine programs, with the right support to engage customers in the moments that matter in vaccines, while rewarding high performers and growth of our vaccines business.

Job Description:

The ABM will be responsible for engaging in account-based business to business interactions within customer segments (Pediatrics, Family/General Practice, IDN/IHNs, Health Systems, and Federally Qualified Health Centers), while presenting clinically focused selling messages to create and grow revenue and to consistently deliver the Sanofi Vaccines portfolio goals.

The ABM will act as an “account orchestrator” to provide a more cohesive customer experience and ultimately improve customer and patient outcomes by leveraging cross-functional support from internal teams across US vaccines. The ABM will demonstrate initiative, drive, and independence, and take ownership for meeting and exceeding individual business goals – simply put the ABM plays the role of business owner for their book of business. This will be accomplished by driving performance and delivering results in a compliant manner with a high degree of integrity.


The ABM will…

•Grow portfolio share and revenue and to consistently deliver on product goals.
•Be a therapeutic area expert, with the ability to position and differentiate products effectively
•Collaborate and coordinate with other key field-based stakeholders such as Medical Science Liaisons, Market Access teammates, strategic account managers, Hospital business managers, and others in their territory to proactively address customer needs
•Identify market dynamics and trends, develop strategies which support brand and corporate objectives, and ensure optimal account success within their assigned geography.
•Engage with the account and territory data, and work with internal data specialists to use insights that help HCPs operate more effectively.
•Determine optimal ABM strategy for HCPs in an agile way leveraging AI and other digital tools
•Drive results by identifying key opportunities and developing strategic business plans to generate product utilization and grow territory business.
•Understand and differentiate portfolio contracting options and compared competitive offerings through financial presentations
•Perform according to a buy/bill model, requiring a specialized skill set for operational support including but not limited to: Complex pricing analysis and price calculator usage, product shipping, monitoring contract compliance and securing contract amendments.
•Flex to changing environments and sales methodologies, including remote selling techniques
•Plan, organize, and execute local promotional speaker programs and activities
•Maximize budget allocated to the geographic territory to support execution of strategies and tactics and generate/ grow the business.
•Participate and help lead initiatives to support sales success as assigned (e.g. participate in industry related congresses, local and regional meetings and medical conferences).

Basic Qualifications

Minimum required skills & experience:
•Bachelor’s degree
• 3+ years of pharmaceutical, life sciences, and/or business to business sales experience
•Broad understanding of the healthcare environment, decision making processes & market trends with a proven track record of accessing decision makers
•Possess skills and success within a business to business environment
•Strong commercial business acumen, strategic, critical thinking/problem solving and innovative thinking capabilities
•Ability to navigate a hybrid environment and determine the optimal HCP selling model
•Can dynamically adjust priorities due to changing circumstances.
•An agile learner who is comfortable operating in complex environments
•Experience with omnichannel approaches, and can execute customer engagement through appropriate channels using insights
•Demonstrated ability to use data and data analytics by unearthing valuable insights from data that can help lead to new solutions for the customer
•Demonstrate a passion and learning aptitude for science and is proactive in strengthening knowledge related to disease-state, treatment options and healthcare trends
•The ability to execute tactical initiatives, provide ongoing feedback, and prioritize multiple products.
•Broad field sales experience with demonstrated success with influencing decision makers
•Self-directed and organized with excellent execution and planning skills
•Excellent communication skills both written and oral
•Must possess valid driver’s license, be eligible for insurance coverage and must be able to safely operate a vehicle


Preferred skills & experience:
•Graduate degree
•A minimum of 5+ years of pharmaceutical, biotech or medical device sales experience with business to business experience
•Preferred 2+ years account management experience
•Enhanced digital acumen
•Strong clinical acumen
•Experience working in Market Access, Pricing, Contracting or Finance
•Proficient with MS Office and customer management databases

Pursue progress, discover extraordinary

Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!


Sanofi US endeavours to make our career center accessible to any and all users. If you are experiencing difficulty and need assistance applying online, please call 1-866-SANOFI2 (1-866-726-6342) or click here.

Sanofi Inc. and its U.S. affiliates are Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employers committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race; color; creed; religion; national origin; age; ancestry; nationality; marital, domestic partnership or civil union status; sex, gender, gender identity or expression; affectional or sexual orientation; disability; veteran or military status or liability for military status; domestic violence victim status; atypical cellular or blood trait; genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing) or any other characteristic protected by law.


The salary range for this position is $100,500 to $160,000. In addition to sales incentive (role may my eligible for long term incentive depending on level and performance); all compensation will be determined commensurate with demonstrated experience. Employees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs. Additional benefits information can be found through the link, www.benefits.sanofiusallwell.com

This position is eligible for a company car through the Company’s FLEET program.

The Sanofi Vaccines team aim is to remain an industry leader through evolving the way we operate and build our new business model. This model will be that can be responsive to fast changing customer needs and environment, engage in a Business to Business activities model that supports the growth of HCPs vaccine programs, with the right support to engage customers in the moments that matter in vaccines, while rewarding high performers and growth of our vaccines business.

Job Description:

The ABM will be responsible for engaging in account-based business to business interactions within customer segments (Pediatrics, Family/General Practice, IDN/IHNs, Health Systems, and Federally Qualified Health Centers), while presenting clinically focused selling messages to create and grow revenue and to consistently deliver the Sanofi Vaccines portfolio goals.

The ABM will act as an “account orchestrator” to provide a more cohesive customer experience and ultimately improve customer and patient outcomes by leveraging cross-functional support from internal teams across US vaccines. The ABM will demonstrate initiative, drive, and independence, and take ownership for meeting and exceeding individual business goals – simply put the ABM plays the role of business owner for their book of business. This will be accomplished by driving performance and delivering results in a compliant manner with a high degree of integrity.


The ABM will…

•Grow portfolio share and revenue and to consistently deliver on product goals.
•Be a therapeutic area expert, with the ability to position and differentiate products effectively
•Collaborate and coordinate with other key field-based stakeholders such as Medical Science Liaisons, Market Access teammates, strategic account managers, Hospital business managers, and others in their territory to proactively address customer needs
•Identify market dynamics and trends, develop strategies which support brand and corporate objectives, and ensure optimal account success within their assigned geography.
•Engage with the account and territory data, and work with internal data specialists to use insights that help HCPs operate more effectively.
•Determine optimal ABM strategy for HCPs in an agile way leveraging AI and other digital tools
•Drive results by identifying key opportunities and developing strategic business plans to generate product utilization and grow territory business.
•Understand and differentiate portfolio contracting options and compared competitive offerings through financial presentations
•Perform according to a buy/bill model, requiring a specialized skill set for operational support including but not limited to: Complex pricing analysis and price calculator usage, product shipping, monitoring contract compliance and securing contract amendments.
•Flex to changing environments and sales methodologies, including remote selling techniques
•Plan, organize, and execute local promotional speaker programs and activities
•Maximize budget allocated to the geographic territory to support execution of strategies and tactics and generate/ grow the business.
•Participate and help lead initiatives to support sales success as assigned (e.g. participate in industry related congresses, local and regional meetings and medical conferences).

Basic Qualifications

Minimum required skills & experience:
•Bachelor’s degree
•3+ years of pharmaceutical, life sciences, and/or business to business sales experience
•Broad understanding of the healthcare environment, decision making processes & market trends with a proven track record of accessing decision makers
•Possess skills and success within a business to business environment
•Strong commercial business acumen, strategic, critical thinking/problem solving and innovative thinking capabilities
•Ability to navigate a hybrid environment and determine the optimal HCP selling model
•Can dynamically adjust priorities due to changing circumstances.
•An agile learner who is comfortable operating in complex environments
•Experience with omnichannel approaches, and can execute customer engagement through appropriate channels using insights
•Demonstrated ability to use data and data analytics by unearthing valuable insights from data that can help lead to new solutions for the customer
•Demonstrate a passion and learning aptitude for science and is proactive in strengthening knowledge related to disease-state, treatment options and healthcare trends
•The ability to execute tactical initiatives, provide ongoing feedback, and prioritize multiple products.
•Broad field sales experience with demonstrated success with influencing decision makers
•Self-directed and organized with excellent execution and planning skills
•Excellent communication skills both written and oral
•Must possess valid driver’s license, be eligible for insurance coverage and must be able to safely operate a vehicle


Preferred skills & experience:
•Graduate degree
•A minimum of 5+ years of pharmaceutical, biotech or medical device sales experience with business to business experience
•Preferred 2+ years account management experience
•Enhanced digital acumen
•Strong clinical acumen
•Experience working in Market Access, Pricing, Contracting or Finance
•Proficient with MS Office and customer management databases

Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.

•Be a therapeutic area expert, with the ability to position and differentiate products effectively
•Collaborate and coordinate with other key field-based stakeholders such as Medical Science Liaisons, Market Access teammates, strategic account managers, Hospital business managers, and others in their territory to proactively address customer needs
•Identify market dynamics and trends, develop strategies which support brand and corporate objectives, and ensure optimal account success within their assigned geography.
•Engage with the account and territory data, and work with internal data specialists to use insights that help HCPs operate more effectively.
•Determine optimal ABM strategy for HCPs in an agile way leveraging AI and other digital tools
•Drive results by identifying key opportunities and developing strategic business plans to generate product utilization and grow territory business.
•Understand and differentiate portfolio contracting options and compared competitive offerings through financial presentations
•Perform according to a buy/bill model, requiring a specialized skill set for operational support including but not limited to: Complex pricing analysis and price calculator usage, product shipping, monitoring contract compliance and securing contract amendments.
•Flex to changing environments and sales methodologies, including remote selling techniques
•Plan, organize, and execute local promotional speaker programs and activities
•Maximize budget allocated to the geographic territory to support execution of strategies and tactics and generate/ grow the business.
•Participate and help lead initiatives to support sales success as assigned (e.g. participate in industry related congresses, local and regional meetings and medical conferences).

Basic Qualifications

Minimum required skills & experience:
•Bachelor’s degree
•3+ years of pharmaceutical, life sciences, and/or business to business sales experience
•Broad understanding of the healthcare environment, decision making processes & market trends with a proven track record of accessing decision makers
•Possess skills and success within a business to business environment
•Strong commercial business acumen, strategic, critical thinking/problem solving and innovative thinking capabilities
•Ability to navigate a hybrid environment and determine the optimal HCP selling model
•Can dynamically adjust priorities due to changing circumstances.
•An agile learner who is comfortable operating in complex environments
•Experience with omnichannel approaches, and can execute customer engagement through appropriate channels using insights
•Demonstrated ability to use data and data analytics by unearthing valuable insights from data that can help lead to new solutions for the customer
•Demonstrate a passion and learning aptitude for science and is proactive in strengthening knowledge related to disease-state, treatment options and healthcare trends
•The ability to execute tactical initiatives, provide ongoing feedback, and prioritize multiple products.
•Broad field sales experience with demonstrated success with influencing decision makers
•Self-directed and organized with excellent execution and planning skills
•Excellent communication skills both written and oral
•Must possess valid driver’s license, be eligible for insurance coverage and must be able to safely operate a vehicle


Preferred skills & experience:
•Graduate degree
•A minimum of 5+ years of pharmaceutical, biotech or medical device sales experience with business to business experience
•Preferred 2+ years account management experience
•Enhanced digital acumen
•Strong clinical acumen
•Experience working in Market Access, Pricing, Contracting or Finance
•Proficient with MS Office and customer management databases

About the job

Our Team:

Are you ready to help further shape the US Sanofi Vaccines to become a more agile, digital, and business to business-driven organization?

Do you thrive in an agile, collaborative, business acumen driven organization where positive outcomes are rewarded? Have you ever wanted to own your own franchise and be accountable to drive business outcomes across a full portfolio of vaccines, and strengthen customer relationships? We are responsible for the implementation of a new go-to market strategy within the US Sanofi Vaccines business unit and searching for several area business managers to pave the pathway forward with us.

Job Description:

The ABM will be responsible for engaging in account-based business to business interactions within customer segments (Pediatrics, Family/General Practice, IDN/IHNs, Health Systems, and Federally Qualified Health Centers), while presenting clinically focused selling messages to create and grow revenue and to consistently deliver the Sanofi Vaccines portfolio goals.

The ABM will act as an “account orchestrator” to provide a more cohesive customer experience and ultimately improve customer and patient outcomes by leveraging cross-functional support from internal teams across US vaccines. The ABM will demonstrate initiative, drive, and independence, and take ownership for meeting and exceeding individual business goals – simply put the ABM plays the role of business owner for their book of business. •Maximize budget allocated to the geographic territory to support execution of strategies and tactics and generate/ grow the business.
•Participate and help lead initiatives to support sales success as assigned (e.g. participate in industry related congresses, local and regional meetings and medical conferences).

•The ability to execute tactical initiatives, provide ongoing feedback, and prioritize multiple products.
