Company Description: We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives

Job Description:
About the job

Job title: Area Business Manager
•Location: Remote / Field
•Travel: Ability to travel up to 75% of the time to customers, conventions, training, and other internal meetings.
•Job Type: Full time

Our Team:

Are you ready to help further shape the US Sanofi Vaccines to become a more agile, digital, and business to business-driven organization?

Do you thrive in an agile, collaborative, business acumen driven organization where positive outcomes are rewarded? Have you ever wanted to own your own franchise and be accountable to drive business outcomes across a full portfolio of vaccines, and strengthen customer relationships? We are responsible for the implementation of a new go-to market strategy within the US Sanofi Vaccines business unit and searching for several area business managers to pave the pathway forward with us.

The Sanofi Vaccines team aim is to remain an industry leader through evolving the way we operate and build our new business model. This model will be that can be responsive to fast changing customer needs and environment, engage in a Business to Business activities model that supports the growth of HCPs vaccine programs, with the right support to engage customers in the moments that matter in vaccines, while rewarding high performers and growth of our vaccines business.

Job Description:

The ABM will be responsible for engaging in account-based business to business interactions within customer segments (Pediatrics, Family/General Practice, IDN/IHNs, Health Systems, and Federally Qualified Health Centers), while presenting clinically focused selling messages to create and grow revenue and to consistently deliver the Sanofi Vaccines portfolio goals.

The ABM will act as an “account orchestrator” to provide a more cohesive customer experience and ultimately improve customer and patient outcomes by leveraging cross-functional support from internal teams across US vaccines. The ABM will demonstrate initiative, drive, and independence, and take ownership for meeting and exceeding individual business goals – simply put the ABM plays the role of business owner for their book of business. This will be accomplished by driving performance and delivering results in a compliant manner with a high degree of integrity.


The ABM will…

•Grow portfolio share and revenue and to consistently deliver on product goals.
•Be a therapeutic area expert, with the ability to position and differentiate products effectively
•Collaborate and coordinate with other key field-based stakeholders such as Medical Science Liaisons, Market Access teammates, strategic account managers, Hospital business managers, and others in their territory to proactively address customer needs
•Identify market dynamics and trends, develop strategies which support brand and corporate objectives, and ensure optimal account success within their assigned geography.
•Engage with the account and territory data, and work with internal data specialists to use insights that help HCPs operate more effectively.
•Determine optimal ABM strategy for HCPs in an agile way leveraging AI and other digital tools
•Drive results by identifying key opportunities and developing strategic business plans to generate product utilization and grow territory business.
•Understand and differentiate portfolio contracting options and compared competitive offerings through financial presentations
•Perform according to a buy/bill model, requiring a specialized skill set for operational support including but not limited to: Complex pricing analysis and price calculator usage, product shipping, monitoring contract compliance and securing contract amendments.
•Flex to changing environments and sales methodologies, including remote selling techniques
•Plan, organize, and execute local promotional speaker programs and activities
•Maximize budget allocated to the geographic territory to support execution of strategies and tactics and generate/ grow the business.
•Participate and help lead initiatives to support sales success as assigned (e.g. participate in industry related congresses, local and regional meetings and medical conferences).

Basic Qualifications

Minimum required skills & experience:
•Bachelor’s degree
• 3+ years of pharmaceutical, life sciences, and/or business to business sales experience
•Broad understanding of the healthcare environment, decision making processes & market trends with a proven track record of accessing decision makers
•Possess skills and success within a business to business environment
•Strong commercial business acumen, strategic, critical thinking/problem solving and innovative thinking capabilities
•Ability to navigate a hybrid environment and determine the optimal HCP selling model
•Can dynamically adjust priorities due to changing circumstances.
•An agile learner who is comfortable operating in complex environments
•Experience with omnichannel approaches, and can execute customer engagement through appropriate channels using insights
•Demonstrated ability to use data and data analytics by unearthing valuable insights from data that can help lead to new solutions for the customer
•Demonstrate a passion and learning aptitude for science and is proactive in strengthening knowledge related to disease-state, treatment options and healthcare trends
•The ability to execute tactical initiatives, provide ongoing feedback, and prioritize multiple products.
•Broad field sales experience with demonstrated success with influencing decision makers
•Self-directed and organized with excellent execution and planning skills
•Excellent communication skills both written and oral
•Must possess valid driver’s license, be eligible for insurance coverage and must be able to safely operate a vehicle


Preferred skills & experience:
•Graduate degree
•A minimum of 5+ years of pharmaceutical, biotech or medical device sales experience with business to business experience
•Preferred 2+ years account management experience
•Enhanced digital acumen
•Strong clinical acumen
•Experience working in Market Access, Pricing, Contracting or Finance
•Proficient with MS Office and customer management databases

Company Description: We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives

Job Description:
​ About the job

Job title: Area Business Manager
•Location: Remote / Field
•Travel: Ability to travel up to 75% of the time to customers, conventions, training, and other internal meetings.
•Job Type: Full time

Our Team:

Are you ready to help further shape the US Sanofi Vaccines to become a more agile, digital, and business to business-driven organization?

Do you thrive in an agile, collaborative, business acumen driven organization where positive outcomes are rewarded? Have you ever wanted to own your own franchise and be accountable to drive business outcomes across a full portfolio of vaccines, and strengthen customer relationships? We are responsible for the implementation of a new go-to market strategy within the US Sanofi Vaccines business unit and searching for several area business managers to pave the pathway forward with us.

The Sanofi Vaccines team aim is to remain an industry leader through evolving the way we operate and build our new business model. This model will be that can be responsive to fast changing customer needs and environment, engage in a Business to Business activities model that supports the growth of HCPs vaccine programs, with the right support to engage customers in the moments that matter in vaccines, while rewarding high performers and growth of our vaccines business.

Job Description:

The ABM will be responsible for engaging in account-based business to business interactions within customer segments (Pediatrics, Family/General Practice, IDN/IHNs, Health Systems, and Federally Qualified Health Centers), while presenting clinically focused selling messages to create and grow revenue and to consistently deliver the Sanofi Vaccines portfolio goals.

The ABM will act as an “account orchestrator” to provide a more cohesive customer experience and ultimately improve customer and patient outcomes by leveraging cross-functional support from internal teams across US vaccines. The ABM will demonstrate initiative, drive, and independence, and take ownership for meeting and exceeding individual business goals – simply put the ABM plays the role of business owner for their book of business. This will be accomplished by driving performance and delivering results in a compliant manner with a high degree of integrity.


The ABM will…

•Grow portfolio share and revenue and to consistently deliver on product goals.
•Be a therapeutic area expert, with the ability to position and differentiate products effectively
•Collaborate and coordinate with other key field-based stakeholders such as Medical Science Liaisons, Market Access teammates, strategic account managers, Hospital business managers, and others in their territory to proactively address customer needs
•Identify market dynamics and trends, develop strategies which support brand and corporate objectives, and ensure optimal account success within their assigned geography.
•Engage with the account and territory data, and work with internal data specialists to use insights that help HCPs operate more effectively.
•Determine optimal ABM strategy for HCPs in an agile way leveraging AI and other digital tools
•Drive results by identifying key opportunities and developing strategic business plans to generate product utilization and grow territory business.
•Understand and differentiate portfolio contracting options and compared competitive offerings through financial presentations
•Perform according to a buy/bill model, requiring a specialized skill set for operational support including but not limited to: Complex pricing analysis and price calculator usage, product shipping, monitoring contract compliance and securing contract amendments.
•Flex to changing environments and sales methodologies, including remote selling techniques
•Plan, organize, and execute local promotional speaker programs and activities
•Maximize budget allocated to the geographic territory to support execution of strategies and tactics and generate/ grow the business.
•Participate and help lead initiatives to support sales success as assigned (e.g. participate in industry related congresses, local and regional meetings and medical conferences).

Basic Qualifications

Minimum required skills & experience:
•Bachelor’s degree
• 3+ years of pharmaceutical, life sciences, and/or business to business sales experience
•Broad understanding of the healthcare environment, decision making processes & market trends with a proven track record of accessing decision makers
•Possess skills and success within a business to business environment
•Strong commercial business acumen, strategic, critical thinking/problem solving and innovative thinking capabilities
•Ability to navigate a hybrid environment and determine the optimal HCP selling model
•Can dynamically adjust priorities due to changing circumstances.
•An agile learner who is comfortable operating in complex environments
•Experience with omnichannel approaches, and can execute customer engagement through appropriate channels using insights
•Demonstrated ability to use data and data analytics by unearthing valuable insights from data that can help lead to new solutions for the customer
•Demonstrate a passion and learning aptitude for science and is proactive in strengthening knowledge related to disease-state, treatment options and healthcare trends
•The ability to execute tactical initiatives, provide ongoing feedback, and prioritize multiple products.
•Broad field sales experience with demonstrated success with influencing decision makers
•Self-directed and organized with excellent execution and planning skills
•Excellent communication skills both written and oral
•Must possess valid driver’s license, be eligible for insurance coverage and must be able to safely operate a vehicle


Preferred skills & experience:
•Graduate degree
•A minimum of 5+ years of pharmaceutical, biotech or medical device sales experience with business to business experience
•Preferred 2+ years account management experience
•Enhanced digital acumen
•Strong clinical acumen
•Experience working in Market Access, Pricing, Contracting or Finance
•Proficient with MS Office and customer management databases

Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.

Company Description: We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives

Job Description:
​ About the job

Job title: Area Business Manager
•Location: Remote / Field
•Travel: Ability to travel up to 75% of the time to customers, conventions, training, and other internal meetings.
•Job Type: Full time

Our Team:

Are you ready to help further shape the US Sanofi Vaccines to become a more agile, digital, and business to business-driven organization?

Do you thrive in an agile, collaborative, business acumen driven organization where positive outcomes are rewarded? Have you ever wanted to own your own franchise and be accountable to drive business outcomes across a full portfolio of vaccines, and strengthen customer relationships? We are responsible for the implementation of a new go-to market strategy within the US Sanofi Vaccines business unit and searching for several area business managers to pave the pathway forward with us.

The Sanofi Vaccines team aim is to remain an industry leader through evolving the way we operate and build our new business model. This model will be that can be responsive to fast changing customer needs and environment, engage in a Business to Business activities model that supports the growth of HCPs vaccine programs, with the right support to engage customers in the moments that matter in vaccines, while rewarding high performers and growth of our vaccines business.

Job Description:

The ABM will be responsible for engaging in account-based business to business interactions within customer segments (Pediatrics, Family/General Practice, IDN/IHNs, Health Systems, and Federally Qualified Health Centers), while presenting clinically focused selling messages to create and grow revenue and to consistently deliver the Sanofi Vaccines portfolio goals.

The ABM will act as an “account orchestrator” to provide a more cohesive customer experience and ultimately improve customer and patient outcomes by leveraging cross-functional support from internal teams across US vaccines. The ABM will demonstrate initiative, drive, and independence, and take ownership for meeting and exceeding individual business goals – simply put the ABM plays the role of business owner for their book of business. This will be accomplished by driving performance and delivering results in a compliant manner with a high degree of integrity.


The ABM will…

•Grow portfolio share and revenue and to consistently deliver on product goals.
•Be a therapeutic area expert, with the ability to position and differentiate products effectively
•Collaborate and coordinate with other key field-based stakeholders such as Medical Science Liaisons, Market Access teammates, strategic account managers, Hospital business managers, and others in their territory to proactively address customer needs
•Identify market dynamics and trends, develop strategies which support brand and corporate objectives, and ensure optimal account success within their assigned geography.
•Engage with the account and territory data, and work with internal data specialists to use insights that help HCPs operate more effectively.
•Determine optimal ABM strategy for HCPs in an agile way leveraging AI and other digital tools
•Drive results by identifying key opportunities and developing strategic business plans to generate product utilization and grow territory business.
•Understand and differentiate portfolio contracting options and compared competitive offerings through financial presentations
•Perform according to a buy/bill model, requiring a specialized skill set for operational support including but not limited to: Complex pricing analysis and price calculator usage, product shipping, monitoring contract compliance and securing contract amendments.
•Flex to changing environments and sales methodologies, including remote selling techniques
•Plan, organize, and execute local promotional speaker programs and activities
•Maximize budget allocated to the geographic territory to support execution of strategies and tactics and generate/ grow the business.
•Participate and help lead initiatives to support sales success as assigned (e.g. participate in industry related congresses, local and regional meetings and medical conferences).

Basic Qualifications

Minimum required skills & experience:
•Bachelor’s degree
• 3+ years of pharmaceutical, life sciences, and/or business to business sales experience
•Broad understanding of the healthcare environment, decision making processes & market trends with a proven track record of accessing decision makers
•Possess skills and success within a business to business environment
•Strong commercial business acumen, strategic, critical thinking/problem solving and innovative thinking capabilities
•Ability to navigate a hybrid environment and determine the optimal HCP selling model
•Can dynamically adjust priorities due to changing circumstances.
•An agile learner who is comfortable operating in complex environments
•Experience with omnichannel approaches, and can execute customer engagement through appropriate channels using insights
•Demonstrated ability to use data and data analytics by unearthing valuable insights from data that can help lead to new solutions for the customer
•Demonstrate a passion and learning aptitude for science and is proactive in strengthening knowledge related to disease-state, treatment options and healthcare trends
•The ability to execute tactical initiatives, provide ongoing feedback, and prioritize multiple products.
•Broad field sales experience with demonstrated success with influencing decision makers
•Self-directed and organized with excellent execution and planning skills
•Excellent communication skills both written and oral
•Must possess valid driver’s license, be eligible for insurance coverage and must be able to safely operate a vehicle


Preferred skills & experience:
•Graduate degree
•A minimum of 5+ years of pharmaceutical, biotech or medical device sales experience with business to business experience
•Preferred 2+ years account management experience
•Enhanced digital acumen
•Strong clinical acumen
•Experience working in Market Access, Pricing, Contracting or Finance
•Proficient with MS Office and customer management databases

•Location: Remote / Field

About the job
We are an innovative global healthcare company that helps the world stay ahead of infectious diseases by delivering more than 500 million vaccine doses a year. Across different countries, our talented teams are exploring new technologies to protect people and promote healthy communities. We chase the miracles of science every single day, pursuing progress to make a real impact on millions of patients around the world.


Our Team:
Are you ready to help further shape the US Sanofi Vaccines to become a more agile, digital, and business to business-driven organization?

  • The ABM will be responsible for engaging in account-based business to business interactions within customer segments (Pediatrics, Family/General Practice, IDN/IHNs, Health Systems, and Federally Qualified Health Centers), while presenting clinically focused selling messages to create and grow revenue and to consistently deliver the Sanofi Vaccines portfolio goals.

  • The ABM will act as an “account orchestrator” to provide a more cohesive customer experience and ultimately improve customer and patient outcomes by leveraging cross-functional support from internal teams across US vaccines. The ABM will demonstrate initiative, drive, and independence, and take ownership for meeting and exceeding individual business goals – simply put the ABM plays the role of business owner for their book of business.   • Grow portfolio share and revenue and to consistently deliver on product goals.

  • Be a therapeutic area expert, with the ability to position and differentiate products effectively

  • Collaborate and coordinate with other key field-based stakeholders such as Medical Science Liaisons, Market Access teammates, strategic account managers, Hospital business managers, and others in their territory to proactively address customer needs

  • Identify market dynamics and trends, develop strategies which support brand and corporate objectives, and ensure optimal account success within their assigned geography.

  • Engage with the account and territory data, and work with internal data specialists to use insights that help HCPs operate more effectively.

  • Determine optimal ABM strategy for HCPs in an agile way leveraging AI and other digital tools

  • Drive results by identifying key opportunities and developing strategic business plans to generate product utilization and grow territory business.

  • Understand and differentiate portfolio contracting options and compared competitive offerings through financial presentations

  • Perform according to a buy/bill model, requiring a specialized skill set for operational support including but not limited to: Complex pricing analysis and price calculator usage, product shipping, monitoring contract compliance and securing contract amendments.

  • Flex to changing environments and sales methodologies, including remote selling techniques

  • Plan, organize, and execute local promotional speaker programs and activities

  • Maximize budget allocated to the geographic territory to support execution of strategies and tactics and generate/ grow the business.

  • Participate and help lead initiatives to support sales success as assigned (e.g. participate in industry related congresses, local and regional meetings and medical conferences).


Basic Qualifications
Minimum required skills & experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree

  • 3+ years of pharmaceutical, life sciences, and/or business to business sales experience

  • Broad understanding of the healthcare environment, decision making processes & market trends with a proven track record of accessing decision makers

  • Possess skills and success within a business to business environment

  • Strong commercial business acumen, strategic, critical thinking/problem solving and innovative thinking capabilities

  • Ability to navigate a hybrid environment and determine the optimal HCP selling model

  • Can dynamically adjust priorities due to changing circumstances.

  • An agile learner who is comfortable operating in complex environments

  • Experience with omnichannel approaches, and can execute customer engagement through appropriate channels using insights

  • Demonstrated ability to use data and data analytics by unearthing valuable insights from data that can help lead to new solutions for the customer

  • Demonstrate a passion and learning aptitude for science and is proactive in strengthening knowledge related to disease-state, treatment options and healthcare trends

  • The ability to execute tactical initiatives, provide ongoing feedback, and prioritize multiple products.

  • Broad field sales experience with demonstrated success with influencing decision makers

  • Self-directed and organized with excellent execution and planning skills

  • Excellent communication skills both written and oral

  • Must possess valid driver’s license, be eligible for insurance coverage and must be able to safely operate a vehicle

Preferred skills & experience:

  • Graduate degree

  • A minimum of 5+ years of pharmaceutical, biotech or medical device sales experience with business to business experience

  • Preferred 2+ years account management experience

  • Enhanced digital acumen

  • Strong clinical acumen

  • Experience working in Market Access, Pricing, Contracting or Finance

  • Proficient with MS Office and customer management databases

Why Choose Us

  • Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team. ​​

  • Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally. ​​

  • Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact. ​​

  • Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks’ gender-neutral parental leave.

Company Description: We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives

Job Description:
About the job

Job title: Area Business Manager
•Location: Remote / Field
•Travel: Ability to travel up to 75% of the time to customers, conventions, training, and other internal meetings.
•Job Type: Full time

Our Team:

Are you ready to help further shape the US Sanofi Vaccines to become a more agile, digital, and business to business-driven organization?

Do you thrive in an agile, collaborative, business acumen driven organization where positive outcomes are rewarded? Have you ever wanted to own your own franchise and be accountable to drive business outcomes across a full portfolio of vaccines, and strengthen customer relationships? We are responsible for the implementation of a new go-to market strategy within the US Sanofi Vaccines business unit and searching for several area business managers to pave the pathway forward with us.

The Sanofi Vaccines team aim is to remain an industry leader through evolving the way we operate and build our new business model. This model will be that can be responsive to fast changing customer needs and environment, engage in a Business to Business activities model that supports the growth of HCPs vaccine programs, with the right support to engage customers in the moments that matter in vaccines, while rewarding high performers and growth of our vaccines business.

Job Description:

The ABM will be responsible for engaging in account-based business to business interactions within customer segments (Pediatrics, Family/General Practice, IDN/IHNs, Health Systems, and Federally Qualified Health Centers), while presenting clinically focused selling messages to create and grow revenue and to consistently deliver the Sanofi Vaccines portfolio goals.

The ABM will act as an “account orchestrator” to provide a more cohesive customer experience and ultimately improve customer and patient outcomes by leveraging cross-functional support from internal teams across US vaccines. The ABM will demonstrate initiative, drive, and independence, and take ownership for meeting and exceeding individual business goals – simply put the ABM plays the role of business owner for their book of business. This will be accomplished by driving performance and delivering results in a compliant manner with a high degree of integrity.


The ABM will…

•Grow portfolio share and revenue and to consistently deliver on product goals.
•Be a therapeutic area expert, with the ability to position and differentiate products effectively
•Collaborate and coordinate with other key field-based stakeholders such as Medical Science Liaisons, Market Access teammates, strategic account managers, Hospital business managers, and others in their territory to proactively address customer needs
•Identify market dynamics and trends, develop strategies which support brand and corporate objectives, and ensure optimal account success within their assigned geography.
•Engage with the account and territory data, and work with internal data specialists to use insights that help HCPs operate more effectively.
•Determine optimal ABM strategy for HCPs in an agile way leveraging AI and other digital tools
•Drive results by identifying key opportunities and developing strategic business plans to generate product utilization and grow territory business.
•Understand and differentiate portfolio contracting options and compared competitive offerings through financial presentations
•Perform according to a buy/bill model, requiring a specialized skill set for operational support including but not limited to: Complex pricing analysis and price calculator usage, product shipping, monitoring contract compliance and securing contract amendments.
•Flex to changing environments and sales methodologies, including remote selling techniques
•Plan, organize, and execute local promotional speaker programs and activities
•Maximize budget allocated to the geographic territory to support execution of strategies and tactics and generate/ grow the business.
•Participate and help lead initiatives to support sales success as assigned (e.g. participate in industry related congresses, local and regional meetings and medical conferences).

Basic Qualifications

Minimum required skills & experience:
•Bachelor’s degree
• 3+ years of pharmaceutical, life sciences, and/or business to business sales experience
•Broad understanding of the healthcare environment, decision making processes & market trends with a proven track record of accessing decision makers
•Possess skills and success within a business to business environment
•Strong commercial business acumen, strategic, critical thinking/problem solving and innovative thinking capabilities
•Ability to navigate a hybrid environment and determine the optimal HCP selling model
•Can dynamically adjust priorities due to changing circumstances.
•An agile learner who is comfortable operating in complex environments
•Experience with omnichannel approaches, and can execute customer engagement through appropriate channels using insights
•Demonstrated ability to use data and data analytics by unearthing valuable insights from data that can help lead to new solutions for the customer
•Demonstrate a passion and learning aptitude for science and is proactive in strengthening knowledge related to disease-state, treatment options and healthcare trends
•The ability to execute tactical initiatives, provide ongoing feedback, and prioritize multiple products.
•Broad field sales experience with demonstrated success with influencing decision makers
•Self-directed and organized with excellent execution and planning skills
•Excellent communication skills both written and oral
•Must possess valid driver’s license, be eligible for insurance coverage and must be able to safely operate a vehicle


Preferred skills & experience:
•Graduate degree
•A minimum of 5+ years of pharmaceutical, biotech or medical device sales experience with business to business experience
•Preferred 2+ years account management experience
•Enhanced digital acumen
•Strong clinical acumen
•Experience working in Market Access, Pricing, Contracting or Finance
•Proficient with MS Office and customer management databases

Pursue progress, discover extraordinary

Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!


Sanofi US endeavours to make our career center accessible to any and all users. If you are experiencing difficulty and need assistance applying online, please call 1-866-SANOFI2 (1-866-726-6342) or click here.

Sanofi Inc. and its U.S. affiliates are Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employers committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race; color; creed; religion; national origin; age; ancestry; nationality; marital, domestic partnership or civil union status; sex, gender, gender identity or expression; affectional or sexual orientation; disability; veteran or military status or liability for military status; domestic violence victim status; atypical cellular or blood trait; genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing) or any other characteristic protected by law.
The salary range for this position is $100,500 to $135,000. In addition to sales incentive (role may my eligible for long term incentive depending on level and performance); all compensation will be determined commensurate with demonstrated experience. Employees may be eligible to participate in Company employee benefit programs. Additional benefits information can be found through the link, www.benefits.sanofiusallwell.com

Company Description: We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people’s lives

Job Title: Associate Director, Health System Marketing - Vaccines
Job Description:
About the Job:

We are an innovative global healthcare company that helps the world stay ahead of infectious diseases by delivering more than 500 million vaccine doses a year. Across different countries, our talented teams are exploring new technologies to protect people and promote healthy communities. We chase the miracles of science every single day, pursuing progress to make a real impact on millions of patients around the world. ​

Job title : Associate Director, Health System Marketing

  • Location : Bridgewater, NJ or Cambridge, MA

Our Team:

Ready to push the limits of what’s possible? Join Sanofi in one of our corporate functions and you can play a vital part in the performance of our entire business while helping to make an impact on millions around the world. As an Associate Director, Health Systems Marketing within our Account Management Sales Organization, you’ll drive the development of relationships with major national healthcare organizations for our Vaccines portfolio. The Account Management Sales organization is a highly skilled team serving our largest and most complex customers while also managing our highest valued vaccine contracts. The customers we call on primarily include Health Systems, IHNs, Medical Groups, PBGs, GPOs, Wholesalers / Distributors, FQHCs and state Awardees.

We are an innovative global healthcare company that helps the world stay ahead of infectious diseases by delivering more than 500 million vaccine doses a year. Across different countries, our talented teams are exploring new technologies to protect people and promote healthy communities. We chase the miracles of science every single day, pursuing progress to make a real impact on millions of patients around the world.

About the Job

The Associate Director, Health System Marketing will…

·       Report into the Account Management Sales organization and focus on achieving Health System (HS) financial objectives.

·       Develop tactical plans that support the HS marketing strategy.

·       Identify & prioritize key HSs by opportunity, create relevant customer tools and resources that help support sustained access to all levels within our HS customers. This includes, but is not limited to C-suite, VP and Director levels in Pharmacy, Clinical, Operational and Quality departments.

·       Support the execution of HS strategies and address customer needs.

·       Recommend and lead the creation of Account Management training resources consistent with our HS strategies and tactics.

·       Communicate and gain alignment on strategic and tactical plans with internal stakeholder groups so they are prepared to support.

About you:

·       Bachelor’s degree.

·       Broad understanding of health system business, decision making processes & market trends with a proven track record of accessing C-suite to D-suite decision makers.

·       Ability to execute plans, tactical initiatives, provide ongoing feedback, and prioritize multiple projects.

·       Broad field sales experience with demonstrated success working with P&T committees, decision makers & influencers in Hospitals, Health Systems and IHNs.

·       Experience in Marketing, Customer marketing and building strategic plans for established portfolios and launch products.

·       A strong self-starter with extensive business acumen and the ability to adapt in rapidly changing environments

Preferred experience:

·       MBA preferred

·       Strong data analytics

·       Experience working in Market Access, Pricing, Contracting or Finance.

·       Proficient with MS Office, customer management databased

Why Choose Us

  • Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team.​
  • Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally.​
  • Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact.​
  • Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks’ gender-neutral parental leave.​

Job Title: Senior Product Manager, Vaccines Marketing, US
Job Description:
Senior Product Manager, Vaccines Marketing

  • Location: Bridgewater, NJ

Our Team:

The US Vaccine Marketing and Commercial Strategy team establishes marketing strategies for the brand and portfolio to manage the P&L and tactic execution, maximizing the upside and minimizing the downside.  With a mission to chase the miracles of science, there is relentless focus on understanding our customers, competition, and market trends to inform value creation solutions, pipeline decisions and leadership of best-in-class product launches.

We are an innovative global healthcare company that helps the world stay ahead of infectious diseases by delivering more than 500 million vaccine doses a year. Across different countries, our talented teams are exploring new technologies to protect people and promote healthy communities. We chase the miracles of science every single day, pursuing progress to make a real impact on millions of patients around the world.

About the Job

You will report to a senior leader of marketing in the Vaccines Marketing group and will be a key member of the Vaccines Marketing and Commercial Strategy Team driviving the success of vaccines and products in either RSV, Flu, or the Sanofi portfolio of vaccines .  You will work closely with other marketing team members who are responsible for various aspects of the marketing mix.  You will also collaborate closely with other functions such as Communications, Field Sales, Public Affairs, Market Research, Medical Affairs, Market Access, and Analytics.

In this role, you may be responsible for:

  • Support development of Consumer and/or HCP strategies and tactical plans to drive brand uptake.
  • Developing and executing HCP campaigns including sales force materials, websites, CRM, banner ads, SEO, SEM, paid search, and other targeted programs.
  • Executing consumer strategy including the development of disease awareness campaigns and DTC advertising via omni-channel marketing.
  • Partner with multiple agencies to produce deliverables on strategy, within timelines, on budget, and measures outcomes across multiple channels.
  • Collaborate with market research and analytics teams to develop research stimuli and manage project plans.
  • Gain key insights to recommend adjustments to strategy and/or tactical execution.
  • Coordinate key performance indicators / metrics to enable performance reporting.
  • Manage the development of multiple marketing assets through the LMR process.
  • Day to Day contact for key tactical projects including creative brief approvals, launch timeline management, and financial management.
  • Coordinate and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
  • Coordinate budget tracking to enable accurate financial reporting.
  • Collaborate in the development and monitoring of brand assumptions, forecasts, and performance.

This is not an exhaustive, comprehensive listing of job functions as the candidate may perform other duties as assigned.  This role may also evolve overtime.

People and Organization

  • Lead cross functional teams
  • Model Inclusion and Diversity principles and behaviors in all ways of working
  • Strengthen the team and the company by creating a winning spirit and by developing excellence-oriented and customer-focused culture, while fostering innovation

About the Role

An undergraduate degree in business or related discipline required. An advanced degree is a plus; an MBA preferred.

Experience

  • 3+ years of relevant industry experience with at least 2 years of in line brand strategy and tactical marketing experience in vaccines or specialty pharmaceuticals preferred
  • At least 1 year of Consumer DTC/patient marketing experience
  • Experience in the US Market
  • Previous launch experience preferred
  • Pediatric, adolescent or older adult vaccines experience preferred
  • Strong knowledge of Sales Training and Sales force engagement
  • Demonstrated experience in working with Regulatory, Legal, and Medical in a solutions -based partnership
  • Ability to both “think strategically” and manage execution details
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to negotiate, communicate, present, persuade a point of view
  • Ability to demonstrate the Sanofi Play to Win behaviors: Stretch, Take Action, Act in the interest of patients and customers, Sanofi First
  • Ability to work effectively in a matrixed team environment
  • Exceptional leadership skills with excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills with the ability to interface seamlessly with other parts of organization.
  • Holds self and others to high degree of integrity, ethics, and accountability

This role is based in Bridgewater, NJ with as estimate of business travel ~25-30% of the time.

Job Description:
Title: Area Business Manager (Dupixent) - Dermatology

Location: Remote, San Jose, CA

About the Job

Are you ready to share the future of medicine? The race is on to speed up drug discovery and development to find answers for patients and their families. Your skills could be critical in helping our teams accelerate progress. Join our Dermatology Team as an Area Business Manager and you’ll help patients and families affected by rare and debilitating diseases .

We are an innovative global healthcare company, committed to transforming the lives of people with immune challenges, rare diseases and blood disorders, cancers, and neurological disorders. From R&D to sales, our talented teams work together, revolutionizing treatment, continually improving products, understanding unmet needs, and connecting communities. We chase the miracles of science every single day, pursuing progress to make a real impact on millions of patients around the world. ​

  • Collaborate and coordinate with other key field-based stakeholders to proactively address customer needs, identify market dynamics and trends, develop strategies which support brand and corporate objectives, and ensure optimal account success within their assigned geography.

  • Drive results by identifying key opportunities and developing strategic business plans to generate product utilization and grow territory business.

  • Plan, organize, and execute local promotional speaker programs and activities.

  • Bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university.

  • 3+ years of pharmaceutical, biotech, or medical device sales experience preferred

  • Highly organized with strong account management skills.

  • Demonstrate a passion and learning aptitude for science

  • Results oriented with a proven track record of success with product launches.

  • Launch experience in specialty care and biologics strongly preferred.

  • 2+ years selling experience in dermatologic disorders such as atopic dermatitis strongly preferred.

  • 2+ years selling sub-cutaneous self-injectable (or office administered IV) biologics in a complex and competitive market.

Job Title: National Business Director - Thymoglobulin- West

Location- Remote/US

About the Job

We are an innovative global healthcare company with a focus on immunology that extends to innovation in diabetes and transplant medicine. Across different countries, our talented teams are determined to deliver a best-in-class customer experience using the best of digital, artificial intelligence and personal know-how. With a focus on immunology that extends to innovation in diabetes and transplant medicines, we pursue progress to make a real impact on millions of patients around the world. ​

Main responsibilities

  • Working with payers in conjunction with the primary regional account director, implements strategies and tactics to support the growth of the kidney transplant patient population.

  • Leading Sanofi’s work with IDNs and Health Systems, implements targeted strategies and tactics tailored to this customer base to educate and promote the clinical and economic value of kidney transplantation.

  • Working with transplant centers in conjunction with the transplant network manager, provides secondary support for kidney transplant MS-DRG and RWE strategic initiatives while also promoting the economic value of kidney transplantation to the transplant centers population-based decision makers.

  • Promotes medical policy coverage in conjunction with the primary regional account lead enabling increased access to kidney transplantation and to our products by providers and their patients.

  • Maintains responsibility for positive business outcomes within overlapping accounts.

  • Assists in creating clear messages for dissemination to sales on important updates in payer trends, reimbursement, government legislation and CMS payment models affecting CKD, dialysis, kidney transplantation and product utilization.

  • Knowledge and experience working in the fields of solid organ transplant, Health Systems and or IDNs

  • Preferred

  • Experience in solid organ transplantation, dialysis, CKD and medical benefit products

  • Therapeutic experience in Immunology, Transplantation, CKD, Dialysis and Chronic Disease

  • Exceptional communication skills that include verbal, written and presentation abilities

  • Experience negotiating medical policy and agreements

  • Excellent project management skills, with the ability to handle multiple projects and meet expected deadlines

  • Skills to successfully lead account teams through collaboration with matrix colleagues across sales, marketing, reimbursement, and other business groups to improve overall effectiveness

Role Criteria

  • Field-based

  • 50% travel

Job title : Head of HCP Marketing, Dermatology

  • Location: Cambridge, MA

POSITION SUMMARY :

The Head of HCP Engagement, Dermatology will be responsible for the development, execution and performance of the Dermatology specialty engagement strategy for the Dermatology and APP community across all current and future Dermatology indications. This role will work closely with cross functional partners including US medical, TLL and sales teams to ensure strategic alignment, collaboration, and executional excellence across the Dermatology HCP Engagement team. This role includes providing strategic leadership of the Dermatology HCP Engagement team and the TLL team. This individual will report to the Head of the Dermatology franchise.

We are an innovative global healthcare company, committed to transforming the lives of people with immune challenges, rare diseases and blood disorders, cancers, and neurological disorders. From R&D to sales, our talented teams work together, revolutionizing treatment, continually improving products, understanding unmet needs, and connecting communities. We chase the miracles of science every single day, pursuing progress to make a real impact on millions of patients around the world.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Own the development, execution and performance of a holistic dermatology specialty engagement strategy for the Dermatology and APP community across all current and future Dupixent dermatology indications.

  • Lead the alignment and coordination of brand strategy for the HCP engagement team and the TLL team to ensure Dupixent and Sanofi have a clear, unified and influential voice within the Dermatology specialty.

  • Provide leadership and direction to a team responsible for all aspects of congress planning, medical meetings, speaker bureau and APP engagement.

  • Provide strategic direction and leadership to the US Dupixent TLL team to develop a short and long-term strategy to support the aspiration to be the partner of choice for the specialty of Dermatology.

  • Key strategic partner with the US medical, TLL and sales teams to ensure strategic alignment, collaboration and executional excellence across the Dermatology HCP engagement team.

  • Lead strategic alignment of Dermatology HCP strategy for Allergist for current and future Dermatology indications.

  • Clearly communicate and champion Dupixent brand strategy with key stakeholders internally and across the alliance.

  • Champion simplification and make critical decisions to simply and create efficiencies for the entire marketing structure.

PIVOTAL EXPERIENCE:

​

Experience :

  • Proven experience (15+ years) in strategic roles within the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry, with a focus on omnichannel strategy, franchise management, and business transformation.

  • Dermatology launch experience with a deep understanding of the current landscape. Demonstrated experience in the US pharma and access environment.

  • Excellent analytical skills with the ability to leverage market research, customer insights, and data-driven decision-making.

Soft and technical skills :

  • Strong leadership abilities and experience managing teams, with the capability to influence and collaborate with cross-functional teams.

  • Change management experience, with a track record of driving successful business transformations.

  • Prioritizes people development, promotes diversity and inclusion, and fosters innovation, transformation, and outside the box thinking.

  • Working knowledge of the regulatory environment, Dermatology, or Biologic experience is a plus.

Job Description:
​ Our Team:

The Marketing & Commercial Strategy team creates and implements customer centric solutions to fully realize the potential of our innovative portfolio and future pipeline. This requires going beyond differentiated (BIC/FIC) vaccine assets to manage complex product operations and devising competitive customer experience advantages. The team includes marketing, early commercial leadership and product operations.  The product operations team provides a strategic advantage as part of brand value propositions delivering best in class customer experiences.  The leader of this team is accountable for product demand integration into global process, managing the partnership with distribution partners, executing the complex product delivery needs of the portfolio and designing/implementing delivery solutions to achieve best in class customer experiences vital to deliver the US Vaccine’s budget, directly impacting over $3B in revenue.

Main responsibilities:

  • Ensure product supply and delivery plans are sufficient to deliver customer commitments and expectations including setting customer targets, establishing service level agreements with external partners (eg. DHL distribution), monitoring performance and triaging readiness for respiratory season volume shipments.
  • Manage distribution governance leading joint steering committee with supply chain.
  • Lead the process to forecast delivery needs and ensure there is sufficient capacity to manage business needs.
  • Integrate and partner with Vaxserve to create One Sanofi product delivery solutions.
  • Represent the voice of the customer in brand customer journey’s and identify a strategic plan to produce best in class delivery results.
  • Implement industry leading solutions to delight the customer including inventory management, automated free returns, delivery integration into e-commerce solutions and supply chain management tool integration within Health systems.
  • Design Flu time to market and customer mix allocations managing continuous strategic alignment with manufacturing and supply chain to achieve prebook shipping commitments.
  • Problem solve supply plan adjustments based on manufacturing releases, disease state evolution, market gaps and customer segmentation.
  • Lead the Beyfortus allocation and reservation program.
  • Lead the Mainline advance purchase program.
  • Create segment specific accommodations, including Long-term-care facilities, Employee Health, Pediatrics and Retail Markets
  • Provide concierge service offerings for prioritized customers define by brand strategies

About you

Basic qualifications:

  • A minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree is required
  • A minimum of 10 years’ pharmaceutical or vaccines experience across both marketing and sales
  • Experience working with global supply chain and manufacturing groups
  • A minimum of 5 years of progressive leadership /people management experience is required
  • This position may require up to 30% overall business travel

Preferred qualifications:

· Advanced degree (e.g. Master of Science, MBA, MD, PhD, PharmD)

· Experience working directly with distributors and implementing customer delivery solutions

Professional Skills:

  • Excellent organizational and project management skills.

· Strong interpersonal and communication skills.

  • Ability to lead in an ambiguous environment across different functions.

· Strategic thinking and prioritizing capacity.

· Demonstrated ability to work effectively with cross-functional groups which may include Marketing, Sales, Research & Development, Medical Affairs, Business Development, Market Research, Public Affairs, Life Cycle Management, and Finance.

Behavioral Competencies:

· Performance orientation and ability to work and deliver along agreed timelines.

· Confident, articulate, and comfortable in team environment.

· Passion for networking and relationship building is strongly preferred.

· Team oriented.

Job Description:
About the job Our Team: The role is part of a high performing team centered on Finance transformation and becoming a best-inclass Finance organization. The Senior Financial Analyst will provide controlling support to their local Business Units, including preparation of budgets and forecasts (Budget / F1 / F2 / Quarterly Landings / Rolling Forecast), monthly closings (sales & expense reviews, scorecards), project approval and tracking, and other financial planning & analysis activities on a timely basis.  As part of the Finance Operations and Transformation team, there will be many opportunities to improve processes and improve collaboration with your Finance partners and business partners to grow and demonstrate your analytical and interpersonal abilities. This person will help to identify and implement new ways of working as we transform the way Sanofi Controls Sales, Industrial Costing, Opex & CAPEX. Main responsibilities: • Position may be responsible for operational controlling activities for sales/gross to net and/or Industrial costing and or operating/capital expenses • Partner closely with Finance Business Partners across GBUs, to provide cohesive and seamless support to Business Leaders • Ensure accurate and timely monthly closing and share monthly results with Finance Business Partners as well as Budget Owners • Prepare monthly commentary to explain variances between actual results and/or budget and forecasts • Ensure business owners are executing the budgeted plan, including tracking actuals, approval of projects & providing direction to business owners • Develop Opex and headcount forecasts for designated areas, in partnership with FBPs and Budget Owners • Oversee and ensure opening and closing of projects as well as the timely capitalization beside compliance with Sanofi methods and procedure regarding Asset Management • Ensure Standard Cost are calculated, POV analyses are followed, and manufacturing performance monitored • Identify risks and opportunities that affect the achievement of these forecasts

Job Description:
Innovation Portfolio Analyst

Location: Bridgewater, NJ

Remote Work: Yes

Job Type: Full time

About the Job

At Sanofi Consumer Healthcare, we have one shared mission – we work passionately, every day, to ‘serve healthier, fuller lives’ now and for the generations to come.

In order to do so, we strive to act as a force for good by integrating sustainability along our business and employees’ mission and operate responsibly from both a social and environmental point of view.

Everything we do is centered around people’s interests – our consumers, our customers, healthcare professionals, and our employees – across the world.

We are building loved brands that serve 1bn consumers worldwide, through our key platforms: Allergy, Physical & Mental Wellness, Pain, Digestive Wellness and Cough, Cold & Flu.

We aspire to become the best Fast Moving Consumer Health (FMCH) company In & For the world and we aim to build a work environment where people can thrive, grow, enjoy and be at their best.

Our Team

The CXA Analytics is a global and fast-growing team with seasoned leaders in business intelligence and advanced analytics. Its purpose is to foster a culture of data-driven decisions and bring the outside-in with access to unique and rich-data on market sales including competitors and consumer choices. Our mission is to empower decision makers to make the right strategic choices and the optimal marketing resource allocation as well as execution. This achieved by building powerful and timely visualizations of market & share developments, quantifying sales drivers uplift & ROI and using unlimited power of algorithm to generate optimal allocation scenario, as well as by anticipating future sales with predictive modelling to anticipate future sales.

Main Responsibilities

The role of Global CXA Innovation Portfolio Analyst is an exciting opportunity to influence CHC strategic choices by providing insights about our innovation pipeline and integrating a robust forecast across the organization. This role implies:

  • Strategic Influence: Play a pivotal role in guiding CHC's strategic choices by delivering key insights from our innovation pipeline.

  • Pipeline Management: Oversee and analyze the CHC Innovation Pipeline, identifying trends, opportunities, and providing actionable insights to Global and Regional Innovation Committees.

  • Forecasting and Alignment : Collaborate with Finance, Sales, and Supply teams to deliver robust and consistent innovation forecasts, aligning them with organizational objectives.

  • Portfolio Optimization : Drive portfolio optimization, focusing on maximizing opportunities and scaling "Bigger and Bolder" innovation projects.

  • Process and Compliance : Work closely with the Innovation Forecast lead to ensure all key innovations comply with organizational standards and that systems accurately reflect outputs

  • Innovation Assessment : Conduct monthly reviews of innovation launch success, deriving insights to inform future strategies.

  • Cloud Visualization Management: Improve and manage cloud visualization tools to enhance organizational access to portfolio insights.

  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with internal and external data science teams to refine data-driven decision-making processes.

  • Support and Integration : Assist project managers and financial teams in gathering and interpreting data on past launches and performance metrics.

  • Innovation Processes & Frameworks: Develop innovation frameworks and processes in close partnership with Global Head of Innovation and Portfolio Manager.

This role will report directly to the CXA global advanced analytics Lead.

About You

  • Experience : 4+ years’ experience in portfolio management or alternatively 4+ years’ working with Innovation projects from design to launch. 3+ years working with senior leadership and effectively synthesizing information with strong emphasis in call-to-action. 4+ years’ experience with ETL from Excel databases and financial P&L statements. Experience working with IPSOS innovation forecast models is a plus.
  • Soft skills : Demonstrated leadership, business ownership, influence & storytelling, collaboration & agile, technical & business fluency, data-driven culture, rigor. Commitment to fostering a data-driven culture, emphasizing accuracy and attention to detail.
  • Technical skills : Experience in Project Management skills including how to plan, execute and oversee innovation projects efficiently. Familiarity with internal innovation pipeline tools is a plus . E xperience in data analysis and interpretation, particularly in synthesizing complex information into actionable insights. Proficiency in Office Suite and Power BI.
  • Education : Bachelor’s degree in a business/marketing or quantitative discipline (e.g., market research, economics, statistics, data science, finance) is preferred. Master’s degree in business/marketing or a quantitative discipline with strong analytics applications is a plus.
  • Languages : English, French is a plus

Job Description:
Job title : Head of Marketing, Dermatology

  • Location: Cambridge, MA

About the Job

The Head of Marketing, Dermatology will be responsible for the US commercial strategy and execution for Dermatology indications. This individual will work closely with the franchise head and cross functional partners to develop and implement strategies and tactics in support of the Dermatology indications for Dupixent. This role includes providing strategic leadership of the Dermatology marketing team. Demonstrated strategic agility and cross-functional leadership with experience in launching dermatology therapeutics and strong customer facing experience is required.

We are an innovative global healthcare company, committed to transforming the lives of people with immune challenges, rare diseases and blood disorders, cancers, and neurological disorders. From R&D to sales, our talented teams work together, revolutionizing treatment, continually improving products, understanding unmet needs, and connecting communities. We chase the miracles of science every single day, pursuing progress to make a real impact on millions of patients around the world.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Own the development, execution and performance of a holistic dermatology strategy inclusive of all indications across HCPs and consumers.

  • Own the dermatology governance across cross-functional partners ensuring alignment to market dynamics, strategy and execution.

  • Responsible for the overall structure and organization of the marketing team including how it should evolve over time as the market and the competitive landscape evolves.

  • Establish and champion a bold ambition focused on the HCP specialist and patients

  • Key stakeholder in developing the commercial forecast for all current and future US Derm indications, including OPEX and P&L management.

  • Provide strategic direction and leadership to the US Dupixent HCP & Consumer brand team to enable development, alignment and execution of strategy across all current (AD & PN) and future Derm indications.

  • Lead development of competitive strategy for current and future competitors.  Provide key insights to influence Sanofi pipeline development for Dupixent and other assets.

  • Key strategic partner with the US medical, TLL and sales teams to ensure strategic alignment, collaboration and executional excellence at all levels of the Derm marketing team.

  • Ensure the right level of Dupixent brand consistency across all specialties and indications through strong collaboration and alignment with other US Dupixent franchise pillar marketing leads and franchise heads.

About you

Experience :

  • Proven experience (15+ years) in strategic roles within the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry, with a focus on omnichannel strategy, franchise management, and business transformation.

  • Dermatology launch experience with a deep understanding of the current landscape. Demonstrated experience in the US pharma and access environment.

  • Excellent analytical skills with the ability to leverage market research, customer insights, and data-driven decision-making.

  • Change management experience, with a track record of driving successful business transformations.

Soft and technical skills :

  • Strong leadership abilities and experience managing teams, with the capability to influence and collaborate with cross-functional teams.
  • Prioritizes people development, promotes diversity and inclusion, and fosters innovation, transformation, and outside the box thinking.

Education :

  • Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, or a related field.

Why Choose Us?

  • Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team.

  • Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally.

  • Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact.

  • Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks’ gender-neutral parental leave.

Job Description:
​

Job title : HEVA Publications Lead

​

  • Location: Bridgewater, NJ

Additional locations655: Gentilly, FR

About the job ​

Are you ready to share the future of medicine? The race is on to speed up drug discovery and development to find answers for patients and their families. Your skills could be critical in helping our teams accelerate progress. Join our Market Access Team as an HEVA Publications Lead and you’ll help patients and families affected by rare and debilitating diseases .

We are an innovate global healthcare company, committed to transforming the lives of people with immune challenges, rare disease and blood disorders, cancers, and neurological disorders. From R&D, to sales, our talented teams work together, revolutionizing treatment, continually improving products, understanding unmet needs, and progress to make a real impact on the millions of patients around the world.

​

Main responsibilities: ​ ​

  • Oversee HEVA Communications Professionals and Publications Agencies
  • Establish HEVA Communications strategy and oversee development of a global HEVA communications plan
  • Manage accountability for adherence to the publication procedures and other compliance expectations
  • Drive innovation within HEVA on increasing the relevance and impact of HEVA evidence communications to value and access objectives.
  • Explore novel channels to communicate more effectively with decision makers on value.

​

About you ​

  • Experience : Five (5) or more years of relevant experience in the pharmaceutical industry, either in a health outcomes organization with responsibility for anticipating and responding to the requirements of health technology assessment, or in a scientific/medical communications capacity with responsibility for developing and implementing publication, dossier, and other scientific disclosure plans
  • Soft and technical skills : ​ Knowledge of Good Publication Practice (GPP).
  • Strong understanding of Global healthcare reimbursement environment.
  • Strong knowledge of regulatory, legal, and ethical standards and policies governing publication and other disclosure of scientific findings.
  • Education : Masters, Ph.D., Pharm.D., M.D., including relevant training in medical writing and publication support , Health Economics, Public Health, Epidemiology, or other relevant health-related scientific discipline

Job Description:
Our Team :

This role reports into the Global Medical Affairs Immunology team that is part of the Medical Affairs Specialty Care organization.
Within the Global Medical Affairs Immunology team, we are proud to support Sanofi’s unrelenting commitment to scientific exploration and to work on a first-in-class treatment and robust pipeline of potential new medicines for chronic dermatologic, respiratory, rheumatologic, and gastrointestinal diseases.

Main responsibilities:

The Global Medical Director will lead the development and implementation of the medical evidence generation plan to support successful development and launch of Amlitelimab (anti-OX40L) in Dermatology.

  • Recognized as an internal subject matter expert and lead Amlitelimab integrated evidence generation strategy, planning and execution worldwide in Dermatology

  • Lead data generation efforts by bridging global ambitions with local affiliates based on in-depth understanding

  • Implement a strong partnership with local cross functional team, global & regional medical for appropriate communications strategy and KOL development

  • Build professional working relationships with Global, Region and key markets, facilitate best practice sharing between global and countries

  • Work effectively within the established corporate and industry compliance guidelines

ABOUT YOU

  • Advanced degree in a scientific discipline (M.D., PhD or PharmD)

  • 5+ years of experience in the biotech or pharmaceutical industry or equivalent Dermatology related experience

  • Significant dermatology therapeutic area experience required

  • Experience in clinical development and/or medical affairs on a global or regional level

  • Experience in both clinical research and patient care

  • Experience working collaboratively and cross-functionally with medical, global brand teams, market research, sales, managed markets, sales operations, business development, regulatory, research & development, manufacturing, finance and legal

  • Strong interpersonal, influencing and communication skills

  • Ability to lead in an ambiguous environment across different functions and company cultures

  • Ability to chart a path and get from strategy to execution, successfully and quickly, amidst ambiguity and change

Job Description:
Senior Manager Market Development Tzield

  • Location: Bridgewater, NJ or Cambridge, MA

About the Job

Ready to push the limits of what’s possible? Join Sanofi in one of our corporate functions and you can play a vital part in the performance of our entire business while helping to make an impact on millions around the world. As Senior Manager, Market Development y ou will lead the tactical execution and operations of the Market Development to support best-in-class planning & execution. You will need outstanding communication and collaboration skills in order to work and to ensure projects and activities are executed in order to achieve the goals and KPIs set out in the Launch & Engagement plans.

We are an innovative global healthcare company with a focus on immunology that extends to innovation in diabetes and transplant medicine. Across different countries, our talented teams are determined to deliver a best-in-class customer experience using the best of digital, artificial intelligence and personal know-how. With a focus on immunology that extends to innovation in diabetes and transplant medicines, we pursue progress to make a real impact on millions of patients around the world.

Key responsibilities

  • Lead Speaker Bureau operations including advertising, and metrics reporting
  • Assist with planning and support the tactical execution of Advisory Boards & RIM
  • Manage budgets and project workflows associated with all assigned projects
  • Other HCP engagements and contracting
  • Understand and work effectively within the established corporate and industry compliance guidelines
  • Ensure alignment with brand strategy and messaging in the development of tactical materials

    • Lead submission and approval of annual ABP

About You

You have experience in working with agencies, rolling out initiatives in the field, working with key opinion leaders as well as navigating internal ways of working such as Medical/Legal/Regulatory review and cross-functional brand teams.

Collaboration, solution orientation and outcome driven are not only buzzwords to you – it’s your mindset and live them every day! You are a strong communicator who can get their point across, and can lead others with clarity and conviction

  • Bachelor’s Degree and 5+ years in Marketing/ Sales and/or other cross-functional leadership roles

  • Strong communication skills, ability to communicate to audiences of varied sizes and levels, both US and global

Preferred Requirements

  • Experience working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Launch experience in the Specialty / Rare disease space desired

About the Job

Job Title: Digital Product Owner (Associate Director) Incentive Compensation
Job Description:
Digital Product Owner (Associated Director) Incentive Compensation (IC) works in a worldwide team accountable for the definition, design, evolution, delivery, and ongoing operation of the products and services supporting field colleagues related to commercial and scientific activities.  This includes the CRM, Events, Transparency, Profiling, Segmentation, Targeting and Territory Design (PSTT), IC, and other supporting commercial applications as part of the overall technology ecosystem including sales force excellence, customer engagement, R&D, and field medical affairs.

In the role of Product Owner IC, he/she delivers the proper PSTT and IC product, using a deep understanding of business processes and technology, to help business stakeholders globally achieve their desired outcomes.

Key Responsibilities

  • Accountable for the development, communication, and execution of global PSTT & IC product strategy and roadmap, collaborating with global and local business partners and other functional and product teams

  • Stay updated on industry trends, market dynamics, and competitor activities to inform product strategy

  • Lead the agile product team (POD) and external vendor(s) to deliver the product. Define user stories and agile iterations. Build and prioritize the backlog, and manage the dependencies with other PODs and Product Owners

  • Ensure that application architecture decisions are consistent between functions, align to enterprise architecture, and leverage opportunities for common approaches. Implement and follow appropriate governance procedures to ensure compliant and efficient computing environments

  • Execute ongoing activities for enhancement requirements gathering and review for continuous product evolutions

  • Co-lead the organizational change management with business partners, and ensure excellent adoption of the PSTT & IC strategies and digital product

  • Continuously improve the way of working within POD and with other partners

  • Ensure that the product meets all controls to address applicable quality, regulatory (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX, etc.) and cybersecurity requirements

  • Ensure service delivery performance according to targets (SLA, OLA)

Main Interactions

  • Omnichannel Sales Product Line Leaders, Product Owners, Architects

  • Digital Product Owners and other colleagues in other areas (CRM, Events, Data, Technology, Finance, HR, etc.)

  • Global and Market Level Business, and Business Process Owner Teams

  • Global Program/Project Leadership

Requirements and Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Engineering, or other relevant fields

  • Self-starter with exceptional communication skills and data-driven mindset

  • Strong work ethic and attention to detail

  • Fluent in English

Minimum Experience & Knowledge Required

  • Demonstrated capabilities and achievements to develop and communicate global product strategy and roadmap, aligning with all key stakeholders

  • Experience in driving successful large-scale global initiatives in top pharma companies

  • Excellent understanding of PSTT & IC processes and in-house/commercial solutions. Hands-on skills and/or experience in running global RFPs and complex contract negotiation will be a plus

  • Proficiency in data analysis and interpretation, with the ability to derive insights to enhance PSTT & IC strategies and product enhancements

  • Strong understanding and experience in Agile methodology and techniques.  2+ years actively involved in an Agile/Scrum environment. Comfortable utilizing Jira, and Confluence, etc.

  • Ability to develop and maintain healthy working relationships with global and local business partners, senior business and IT leadership, colleagues, consultants, and vendors

  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, including tact and diplomacy to exchange and escalate information throughout a matrix organization

JOB-SPECIFIC SKILLS & COMPETENCIES                                 PROFICIENCY

Lean & Agile practices                                                                  Advanced

User Experience                                                                            Intermediate

IT strategy & Governance                                                            Advanced

Project Management                                                                   Advanced

Application Design & Integration                                                Advanced

Compliance of Computerized systems                                        Intermediate

TRANSVERSAL SKILLS & COMPETENCIES (SOFT & BEHAVIORAL SKILLS)               PROFICIENCY

Business Acumen                                                                                                     Advanced

Transversal collaboration                                                                                        Advanced

Strategic Thinking                                                                                                    Advanced

Decision Making                                                                                                      Intermediate

Business Partnership                                                                                               Advanced

Change Management                                                                                              Advanced
